Reviews.Title: “Under-rated option right in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: karlkangus
Reviews.Content: This hotel lies pretty much right outside of Termini station in Rome. The rooms are very small by American standards but very normal for Rome and other large European cities. But since it is operated by Best Western, Americans tend to be overrepresented there. So it is my theory that that's why it has slightly lower reviews than other local hotels. Everything was super clean, and the staff was quite friendly. Above all, where else can you stay in Rome's city center for 80 euros a night? Internet was actually the only problem. They claim they have free wifi, but I never got it to work, and when I called downstairs, they said that they will send someone up but that never happend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: klinika
Reviews.Content: Location is great, 30 meters from Republica, 300 meters from Termini. Rooms are spacius (Roma standard), it is maybe a bit overpriced. Used a garage, 30 Euro per day is a bit much, but conveniant. Next to a hotel is a great restaurant ("Cotto"). Breakfast is good, and staff is very nice. I talked out my Italian, but their English is very good, which is not a standard in Rome. Rooms are very clean, although, it could be a time for renewal...

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Denisa D
Reviews.Content: i got exactly what i expected for the price - good service, clean room & bathroom, nice people. the hotel is in good location (close to metro station and train station Termini) and easy to find. next to the hotel is a good restaurant and a snack/food shop - very practical. i slept like a baby there - rooms are silent, with comfortable wide beds. breakfast was good, unfortunatelly without fresh vegetable, but balanced by very good croissants. :)

Reviews.Title: “Second trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: opatt
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Rome. My husband and friends decided to stay here at this hotel. It was truly a great experience. Hotel was close to the Termini. Hotel personnel was wonderful and very helpful. Great location to walk around. Would stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: MrsO071
Reviews.Content: just home from two nights in hotel Mondial the best thing about it is the location great for train,bus and metro. The room was large but basic. The breakfast was at a good time and there was a reasonable selection of hot and cold food. You can have tea and coffee making facilities in your room at no extra cost but you have to collect it from the bar otherwise you will be charged for roomservice. ?4 star rating

Reviews.Title: “Rude experience”
Reviews.Author: VIESSE
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel for work in March 2012 and my experience has been really poor. Apart from the position, very close to stazione Termini (5-10 min walking), I can hardly believe that this hotel is 4stars. The furniture, both in the lobby and rooms, is old and basic. I had a superior room the was quite big and the bed was quite comfortable, but the problems were the hot temperature (and we're not in summer yet) and the unbelievable empty minibar: just two little complimentary bottles of water for the first day, and then you have to go for yourself ordering something at the bar in the lobby, otherwise the minibar will remain left. When I phoned at the reception for another bottle of water during my second evening there, they told me that the bar at that time was closed so there was nothing to do. Moreover, the breakfast is very poor: just some cereals,croissants, non fresh fruit (just the canned one) and espresso and cappuccino from a do-it-yourself machine. But that's not all folks: at the end of the stay, one my colleague had huge problems with the reception staff because they lost some e-mails from our agency with credit card data and they were pretending us to pay again by ourselves...the worst thing has been the rude and unkind behavior of the receptionist, since he had the fault of this misunderstanding. All these things are unacceptable for a 4stars hotel, and for 150€/night (our rate for this stay) you can easily go for better solutions in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Rome City break”
Reviews.Author: normata69
Reviews.Content: The situation of the hotel is excellent. 2 mins away from metro, 5 mins Termini train station. Staff are very helpful all English speaking. Room was excellent, recently refurbished very clean, bathroom very modern and good shower. Breakfast was not too bad. Eat as much as you like, good timings 06.45 am - 09.45 am which gives you flexibility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but room was very hot”
Reviews.Author: jenninberks
Reviews.Content: Hi there, This hotel is in a great location - close to the metro, right next to a restaurant/bar and a cool shop with wine and chocolate. In addition, the staff are quite pleasant. Unfortunately, the room I stayed in was very hot (room 404). I was on the 4th floor and upon arrival, I rang down to the front desk and told them that my room was too hot. They advised that I could not change the thermostat as it's locked and cannot be changed by customers - they advised my only choice was to turn it completely off. I did this and the temp stayed 26.6 degrees (80 F) the whole time (2 nights). Although I opened the window, it just did not cool down and I did not sleep. A friend of mine also stayed (in room 411) and had the same experience. I would recommend this hotel without reservation if they would allow customers to choose the thermostat level for which is best for their needs - the way it is however, I would say stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: mikel58
Reviews.Content: For the price it was exceptional value. The twin room was large, the beds comfortable. The Metro is round the corner and once you work out where the buses go, there is one that stops on the corner. get the 3 day travel pass - and hop on and off hotel has good advice too.

Reviews.Title: “Good double rooms, 3 star breakfasts, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: AliceKlarr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a large, double room, which was clean and good value for money. The room had a safe and a small TV. The bed was vast and the mattress was firm. By international 4 star standards, however, the buffet breakfast needs attention. Too much of the food had come straight out of a can or a packet: too little of it was fresh. For example, in a country full of oranges in February why was sugary, orange-flavoured, juice concentrate dispensed from a plastic bottle? Where were the fresh oranges? On the plus side, it's almost impossible to fault the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, if unspectacular...”
Reviews.Author: ggillespie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Feb 2012 and found it to be comfortable if unspectacular. Good city centre location close to Termini train station. The hotel staff were extremely polite and helpful and our room was cleaned each night without issue. The room did not have any coffee/tea making facility and it looked like it hadn't been decorated since 1990. But it was clean, comfortable and spacious so for the price I don't think I can argue too much. I stayed in a triple room and one of the beds was converted from a sofa, which meant the person who slept on it didn't sleep well. My only major issue was the standard of breakfast, which was utterly appalling (most of it wasn't fit for a dog). I would stay here again though and would definately recommend it for it's price range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Yujin K
Reviews.Content: walking distance to Termini station and all other touristic area. nice quality rooms, excellent service. especially the front desk clerk served us really nicely. I will definitely visit here again if I have a chance to visit Rome. Thanks for nice service!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Best Western in Rome's heart”
Reviews.Author: ttttwwww
Reviews.Content: I phoned the hotel on the day in mid-November and got a great price on a small, single room (50 Euro, breakfast included). Must have been a slow period. They had a sale on for WiFi and movies: 5 Euro (normally 10). The room was clean, had a nice washroom with toilet, bidet, and shower. It was near an elevator, but usually the hotel was pretty quiet at night. Occasionally, when it wasn't, I used ear plugs and no problems. Breakfast was okay, typical continental, pour your own cappuccino. Location was right near Reppublica plaza, near the metro.

Reviews.Title: “I was glad I choose this hotel also my friend was surprised by the good qualitty.”
Reviews.Author: L M
Reviews.Content: Hi, I've been reading a lot of reviews about hotels in Rome.It helped me to find good hotel in the city center,near metro station (great location!),beautiful decorations and nice stuff. The room was a little bit small (I know there was a bigger rooms) but I and my friend was satisfied by the cleanliness and convenience. The bathroom was big and clean.Breakfast was various and tasty.The stuff were nice and helpful.We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights.Our stay in Rome was extra pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: lucky m
Reviews.Content: We thought that is 4 star hotel but it was worst choice possible. The rooms are worse than hostel rooms. Like somebody says cheap furniture and nasty pink walls. The carpet is dirty. The beds are so uncomfortable. The tv in the room is from past century. The hotel is not renovated since 1972. Especially from their staff ( Mrs. Valentina ) we got very impolite and bad service. We paid by cash there and do not get regular bill and worst of all was thing that they block 400 euros more on our credit card for some deposit 30 days. When I asked Mrs. Valetina to send me confirmation that it is only blocked amount and that they will not use it she promise that she will send it via e mail. I wait more than 25 days for one e mail and when I called again for that ( I called more than 10 times ) she was rude and again impolite and told that "my problem is not their priority and she will never send that e mail to me". And when I ask to speak with someone reasonable there and maybe some manager she told that she is boss even she is not !!! This is unbelievable behaviour of some hotel staff. I do not have any word to say more except that I recommend everyone to avoid this hotel with unprofessional staff and incorrect to client all time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cmh_org
Reviews.Content: What was lacking in customer service, they made up in a convenient location and a comfortable room & hotel. The Hotel Mondial was a great place to stay for a couple of nights and we'd stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “High standard for average budget traveller who wants ease of travel!”
Reviews.Author: happy0nh0lidays
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located for all transportation departures. The Termini train station,bus depot and Metro ( subway) are 1 1/2 easy blocks away from the Mondial. Via Nationale (a main street) is 30 steps out the front door.This allowed us to go to all tourist sites in Rome with impressive ease. The hotel staff are very helpful and the rooms were larger and better than what we expected for European standards. The buffet breakfast was average.Restaurants are plentiful and 24 hour fruit and drink stands are 1 block away. The hotel will make taxi arrangments to pick you up at the airport and the prices will be same as finding one for yourself. We took a train to leave Rome to go to the port to get a ship and pulling the heavy luggage was an easy walk from the hotel. This is a great hotel to stay at while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very good 4-star in a quiet but convenient location””
Reviews.Author: ofer s
Reviews.Content: me and wife spent 5 days in rome and we choose this hotel,The hotel is located on Via Torino, 5 min walk from termini station, Rome's main railway and bus terminal. we got great room in the 4th floor , the room was reconditioned and bathroom was wonderful. I have paid 5euro for internet each day. the breakfast was very goog. The staff were very kind,we would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good 4-star in a quiet but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: John_CornerBrook
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Via Torino, a quiet street just 7-8 minutes walk from Roma Termini, Rome's main railway and bus terminal. It is also just steps away from the main bus line for tourists (#64) which takes you quickly to Vatican City. The property is well managed and is in immaculate condition, inside and out. For a 4-star hotel, we found the price to be quite reasonable, but nothing is cheap in Rome! The room was large by European standards and was very well equipped with modern applicances. The included continental breakfast was well stocked on a timely basis with a large selection, mostly of cold items as is the tradition on that continent. At our time of visit, air conditioning was not necessary, but we tried it and it worked well. We would stay there again if and when we get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ari L
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 nights last week. The location of the hotel is very good, only few hundred meters from subway (Rebuplica square) and in walking distance to most of the sightseeings in the city center. The staff have EXCELLENT SERVICE ATTITUDE and they really give their best to make you enjoy your staying there. I think that has big value as total - namely I have also other experiences from other hotels in Roma. Breakfast is versatile and delicious. If you are seeking for modern and "glittering" decoration this is not perhaps your first choice. Instead of that in Mondial there is a nice historical athmosphere and I myself liked that much. Rooms are very clean and there is everything you need. Lobby, breakfast room and bar are good level. I would describe this hotel as "cozy". There is a bit of city noice at least in the street side, but it didn't actually bother us at all. On the contrary, if you are in city holiday it makes the perfect athmosphere so that you feel that you are in big city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Benamard
Reviews.Content: The hotel has two things working for it: the location (right near republicca station, and very near Termini station) and the excellent staff. They were all cheerful, funny, and plenty of help, and most important - spoke very good English. They booked restaurant reservations at our requests, answered every question we had, and gave us some tips on where locals go (and not tourists). The breakfast included in the price of the room (we booked through booking.com) was a standard american affair, we found it lacking in variety but the quality was there. The rooms are very well insulated, we couldn't hear a peep from our room, even though it was very close to the elevators. The bed was a bit too hard for out taste, but that IS a matter of taste and what you're used to. The room and the hotel in general was VERY clean and well maintained. I will be more than happy to come back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place!”
Reviews.Author: ash007London
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and near the train / bus station. This is a good hotel with good service. Staff were helpful. It might be a Best Western but there is nothing too generic and boring about this place (like most Best Westerns or hotel chains). It seems to be quite different. Our room was comfortable and clean although a little small. Would stay again here. It was not the best place I have ever stayed in but more than functional and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sharon C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Mondial. Good location, near the metro and the train station was not too far away. We took the metro to the Vatican otherwise we walked everywhere (Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps). It was very convenient. The room was very large. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very modern. The breakfast was very good...a selection of hot and cold items. The staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Trip To Rome”
Reviews.Author: paddysdaddy_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mondial for one night , Aug.25th before leaving on a 10 day Cruise out of Civitavecchia. We enjoyed the hotel and the surrounding area, and decided to return for two more nights (Sept. 11th and 12th) following the cruise, and a week in Tuscany. We found the staff to be very helpful, especially Diego. The rooms were more than adequate, for a European hotel. Very clean and comfortable for two.The breakfast (included), was a nice surprise. There were many choices, both hot and cold. There were several good restaurants, cafes, bars and shops within walking distance. But we found Ristorante COTTO, right next door to be excellent, for both food and drink! We were able to walk to many tourist attractions including Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps and many churches and squares. We took a cab to The Coliseum for 7 Euros, and the Vatican/Sistine Chapel for 12 Euros. We would definitely recommend The Mondial to friends, and hope to return for a longer stay. Linda and David Casey New Brunswick, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 4 stars in my eyes!”
Reviews.Author: satirical
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel before transferring to a cruise in Civitavecchia! The hotel was ideally situated for C. Rome/Termini etc & we got to see a couple of attractions; accomodation was ok but would have expected more from a 4 star; we have stayed at a Best Western before in UK & found them very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: moncherrie
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of a single thing to complain about this hotel. The only problems we experienced in the entire city, had nothing to do with this establishment. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. They went out of their way to accommodate a couple of issues we had...not being equipped with the right adapter for electronics. Every question we had, they answered promptly... It is an older building but it was very clean and very well decorated. It is absolutely beautiful. They have a full breakfast included each morning....with the exception of the scrambled eggs, was very tasty. I wish I had gotten his name, but the young man at the front desk (home in Brazil) was one of the nicest people we dealt with on our entire trip. Rome itself could use a good cleaning, but the Best Western, Hotel Mondial is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Cardinal2B
Reviews.Content: Cost was, by Rome standards, very reasonable. Wi-Fi is spotty, to be charitable. It is FREE only if you reserve direct through Best Western, otherwise they charge for it. Service was fair, until we lost a passport, then they were VERY helpful

Reviews.Title: “Good location for all the sites”
Reviews.Author: silverdale15
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Rome and it was unforgettable. We booked on line for two nights at the last minute as we were staying in Milan at the time and travelled down in their high speed train which was an experience in itself, 300 kph! The hotel was well within easy walking distance from the station. We arrived at the hotel about 1300hours and the room was not ready but this did not matter to us as we left our bags and went straight out to walk to Colosseum where we spend the afternoon. Got back to the hotel at about 1900hrs and found the room to be very comfortable with large en-suite bathroom. Breakfast was adequate with all the usual options and we ate heartily to prepare ourselves for a long day. Hotel is close to the Metro and we took it to the stop nearest the Vatican where we spent the whole day before walking back via the Trivi fountain and Spanish Steps. It was not that far. There are loads of restaurants nearby as you would expect so no problems with the evening meal. The Hotel does have its own restaurant but we did not use it although did take advantage of happy hour at the bar! There is a great shop/deli just next door that is well worth a visit. We thought the hotel ideally placed to see the Rome antiquities but we do enjoy walking around cities. There is the usual 'open top' hop on/off bus tours and you can join these at the Rail Station. So yes I would recommend this hotel to you. I believe it has four star rating and good value for money. Last and by no means least the staff were extremely helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel... Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Prashant J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August and enjoyed the fantastic sights of Rome... The location of the hotel is absolutely fabulous.. Its a 5 minute walk from the termini station and even closer to Republica (with its Metro station and the fountain).. The hotel inside is decent though you would expect a bit from a four star. The room that we got was quite big but looked in need of refurbishment. The breakfast was good but I thought the service could have been better. Also, the person in-charge of reception at night was a bit rude when I wanted to enquire about public transportation routes. There is no tea-coffee in the room and although you can ask for it from reception, you'll have to go down to the bar yourself to get it (which I thought was a bit weird). If you're not too fussed about the look of your rooms and average service then this can be a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 star not 4 for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Bastian B
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and the guy at reception was funny, so 1+ for that! The hotel in general is located near metro (2 min. walk) and from main railway station about 10 min. by walk. Even from Coloseum you can walk (circa 25 min.) In general the hotel looks quite nice. The down sides for our taste were: Unfilled mini fridge besides two bottles of water, the breakfast was bit below the average and the pillows to thin. The room was big enough with air-condition and the balcony was acceptable regarding the size. Our room was next to the street, but the windows are good isolated, so the noise was really minimal. The bathroom was really big and nice! The bed was really good! Regarding the mini fridge, I don't know how other people look at it, but we do more or less eat and drink most of it, and sometimes it's like a box of chocolate regarding what they select for their guests, too disappointing about the empty mini-fridge. Regarding breakfast, well bit bigger selection of salty-food and more fresh sweets would have not harmed anybody. The internet access was possible also in the room, as wifi, but due to a technical failure and holiday season it was not possible to fix it; they said so at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “One incident but for Rome that's pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: Samserena
Reviews.Content: Best western mandible was great to my boyfriend and I. The rooms were well kept and the breakfast was decent. The location is good to get to the terminal station which is what we wanted but we knew the termini is a bit rough. We only had one incident and that was with out airport transfer - there was no one waiting and no one coming and a lot of confusion. So we ended up being at the hotel a couple of hours after getting to the airport at a lovely 3am. But the staff was great the rest of the time and were fantastic when I was unwell and stuck in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtomicTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated not to far from termini (the main railway station) in a good location close to numerous shops, bars and restaurants. The room I had was clean and of good size, with a comfortable bed. Breakfast was adequate, although the selection was perhaps more limited than other hotels. Staff were friendly. In all Rome hotels, there is a tax of around 3 euro per night which is usually added to the bill at the end of the stay. For some unknown reason, this hotel insists on payment of this on check-in, so be aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel to suit needs of sightseer to this fabulous City”
Reviews.Author: supersailor
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mondial close to all tourist attractions. No need to take local transport as best way to see this fabulous city is to walk. Tour operated buses although regular, recommend 'Cristina Busses' as extremely regularly compared to other competitive buses and give a wider area to step off bus to see attractions on offer. Hotel staff fairly friendly apart from immediate booking in was asked to pay additional duty tax!! 30 euros for length of our stay! Happy hour at 5pm at gloomy bar area. Breakfast adequate only. Room clean but limited space for our facilitles.As done research for all Tourist attractions, did not seek advice from helpful reception staff. Took train from airport but weighed up the cost would have paid the litle extra cost to get a taxi. Pre book Vaticum, Coloceum as it gets very busy. Worth paying the extra Euros to get a guide to both attractions. We went to a restaurant called Amore Mio TWICE - brilliant food, cheap and excellent value for the price. (Tel 0689828618).

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Irina M
Reviews.Content: Exelent location, clean, good breakfast. The staff are very friendly, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Females beware”
Reviews.Author: kiarak75
Reviews.Content: As a business woman travelling far and wide, I had never experienced being stopped upon entering the hotel in the evening to be prompted for a key as proof of staying at the hotel. After a dinner meeting I returned to the hotel around midnight and while heading towards the lifts I was called by the night receptionist, who apparently wanted to check if I was a guest or a "friend of a guest" if you know what I mean! Which makes me wonder if this is a frequent occurence at this hotel! Anyway, he asked out loud for my room number, in front of other 3 male guests at the reception desk. I then approached the reception, handed my key's holder with number on it to avoid letting the other guests know what my room was. The moron read the number out loud, checked the system and pleased in realizing I wasn't a hooker he wished me good night. First of all, if an hotel is experiencing hooker's problems, then they should put someone at the door to discreetly prevent unwelcomed people from enetering the premises, instead of embarassing hotels' guests who, by the way, were wearing knee long bermuda shorts and flat shoes! Secondly, it's common practice at 3* hotel chains to avoid putting female guests at risk by letting everyone in the lobby know where they are staying. Clearly staff at this 4* hotel don't have a clue of such basics. I work for a hotel chain abroad and I can honestly say this service is not of a 4* standard. The hotel is in a great location, but as a hospitality professional myself, I believe service is more important. Next time I'll choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location, Staff = Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Marza78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Mondial for two nights and I could not be happier with the price and location of this hotel. It is within easy walking distance from the train station and it took me about 15 minutes to walk to the Trevi Fountain from the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I needed to print out my boarding pass for my flight in the morning and the overnight staff was happy to help. They speak excellent English and are willing to help you with restaurants, transportation, and tours. The room was small but just the right size for me, the bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom was large but the shower was tiny...but not a big problem. I booked the hotel through venere.com and for the price it was a bargain. I did not have breakfast at the hotel so I cannot review it. I did use the internet for 5 euro per night and I wish it was included in the price but it is not a dealbreaker, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE - FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: yankeerome
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel which is near the Rome main station (definitely not one of my favorite areas of Rome) - and was pleasantly surprised. First the area is much better. Our hotel is convenient, with great air conditioning, quiet and the staff couldn't have been more friendly. Our room large, especially for Roman Hotels - even the 5 star hotels don't give you space. The breakfast was good, everything fresh and good. The bar as quiet and nice too. Stefano the guy at the front desk was super nice and Aly the bartender very helpful and intelligent. Since I had lived in Rome for 38 years of my life, I really know Rome and its various hotels - and although I am not usually a fan of Best Western Hotels - this one is definitely worth returning to. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the city center, but rooms have to be refurbished”
Reviews.Author: Marek79
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in Best Western Mondial Roma. Hotel is located within walking distance from Termini and next to Via Nazionale – one of the main streets in Rome, where you can find many shops, which are open all week and till late hours. Part of the sightseeing attractions, like Fontanna di Trevi, Colloseum, Spanish Steps are also located not far from the hotel. But if you want to go to Vatican you should take a bus or metro – it’s about 5 km from the BW Mondial. Reception is very efficient and nice. In the lobby you can also find Internet point, where access for the internet is free of charge for guests, who booked their stays via bestwestern.com. Lobby and corridors look welcoming, however rooms needs to be upgraded. I saw that part of them had already been refurbished. Unfortunately our room was before upgrading. In the room we had TV, minibar and possibility to use internet (but not free of charge). Bathroom was spacious but had a shape of a letter L. Breakfast was included in the price of the room. There were ham, cheese, milk, yoghurts, some cereals, scrambled eggs, very juicy oranges and drinks (tea, coffee, juice). One day they even offered donuts – very tasty. The only downgrade was the size of the breakfast room and a number of tables. In February it was quite OK, but I guess that in summer you may have a problem with a table.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KiloTango
Reviews.Content: This is a super jumping off point for Rome if you are arriving and departing rome by rail, as it is within walking distance of the Roma Termini station. It is actually on the same block as the Republica metro stop which you will use for touring the city, but don't bother if you are coming from Roma Termini...just walk. We had two rooms for three days and found the rooms quiet, comfortable and perfect for our needs. One of the few n our trip that provided free internet as well as breakfast. I'd read some earlier reviews that suggested the conditions in some rooms were questionable, but we found our rooms and bathroom spotless. Elevators are small, but that is part of the quirkiness of Rome. For some reason we really enjoyed the breafkast here more than any of the other hotels on our trip. Not sure why, as they are all similar, but perhaps the food was a little fresher, and the waiting staff was pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “simply great!”
Reviews.Author: pvmarcallo
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome just for one night last week. I stayed at Best Western Hotel Mondial. It was my third time there and everything was perfect as usual. Maybe this time even better than usual thanks to a very special guy at the reception who gave me a wonderful room on the fourth floor. Going back soon! If there's something I don't like is the coffee they serve at breakfast. Avoid it if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, extremly friendly staff and beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: mosharebud
Reviews.Content: We found this place quite by accident after being booked into another hotel that was less than appealing and in a very bad area. When we came into the lobby we were greeted with smiles and excellent assistance. Steffano at the front desk could not have been more helpful! He placed us into a beautiful room that was spacious and very clean with a wonderful view. The location is very nice right around the corner from one of the hop on hop off tours, which made it extremely convenient. We were two women traveling together and were not afraid to walk back and fourth after dark here. The hotel offered a 24hr package of unlimited pay-per-view movies and wi-fi for only 5 euros, which was probably the bargain of the trip. I liked the service and loved the staff and would absolutely stay with them again. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, typical Italian style decorated rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Anto0429
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed staying at this hotel, particularly the typically Italian style decorated rooms (very high ceilings (like the old Venetian villas, since it's a 19th century building), comfortable carpets everywhere, large windows with thick, red curtains and romantic, old-style shutters). Loved opening the windows in the morning and hearing the pulse of the city, people talking and motorcycles passing by, but in spite of the "noise" during the day, evenings and nights were quiet, with a cooler air in our room (in spite of the fact that we went at the beginning of June and it was quite hot during the day, except for 2 days, when it rained), suitable for getting a good rest. Rooms were very comfortable, cosy, spacious and clean, bathroom nice, with a mirror-door and all necessary facilities. The only thing that could perhaps be improved is the food-variety at breakfast (maybe some tomatoes, salads, vegetables in general), but the quality of the offered food is good, classic breakfast. The hotel’s location on Via Torino is very convenient, less than 2 minutes away from the Roman opera (Teatro dell’Opera) and you can find all amenities nearby: the lovely Via Nazionale, a taxi station, Repubblica metro station just 5 minutes away, hairstylists and so on. I would definitely recommend booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice room and good location”
Reviews.Author: JBIPix
Reviews.Content: I had a single room in late May and early June. The room was small, very clean & super quiet but with no view. Air conditioning was perfect. Breakfast was copious and varied with professional staff and served in a large and well appointed breakfast room. If you have free internet included be sure to ask for your code daily. Location was great as it's 5 minutes walking distance to Termini and 30 minutes or less walking through interesting streets to main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great standard and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pkandjulie
Reviews.Content: Our 4 day stay in Rome for our group of 4 was excellent. The 2 rooms we had were very good with the buffet breakfast of only a reasonable standard but with overall good balance at a good price for this location. The position was the most important thing. Short walks to shopping, many significant landmarks, bus routes and Metro were only made difficult by "happy hour"' (for 4 hours) at our hotel, the bar next door and several others nearby. The hotel Staff were friendly and helpfull, especially Alberto who helped with some internet booking issues before we even arrived. Highly reccommended

Reviews.Title: “If service means anything, this is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thomas48
Reviews.Content: I actually did not stay here, but next time I'm in Rome, I will definitely try it out! It's a beautiful hotel near the Teatro dell 'Opera. After the opera, my friend and I were looking for a cab back to our hotel. We stopped in the Mondial and asked the desk manager if he could assist us in calling a cab. Not only did he make arrangements for the cab to arrive in FOUR minutes, he also spoke to our cab driver to negotiate a fair price, since our hotel was quite a ways out. I was so impressed, that I felt compelled to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: RuthieW
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, good location, clean, free, internet, and very friendly evening/night reception personel. The rest..... Tiny (REALLY tiny) dark room facing a noisy ventilation shaft. Very depressing feeling. Matress hard and lumpy. Pillow, like a brick, nothing softer to choose between. The TV didn't work so they sent someone up to check. Result? Something wrong with the "line". Next morning I saw that the TV in the breakfast area was on so I mentioned that on my way out and was assured that mine would be working by the time I came back that evening............... which was not the case. They then told me that the entire hotel was down with the exception of the breakfast room as that was not on the same "line" ??!?!? One hour later (22.00 in the evening) I get a call that someone is coming to change my TV. Oh, so it was the TV's fault now, not the "line"? Couldn't they have come to that conclusion yesterday? (By the time I had a functioning TV I was too tired to watch CNN) Breakfast was awfull, absolutely not worth the cost. Dry bread, watery scrambled eggs, luke warm yogurt.... need I say more? (But, the staff was very friendly and very effective at quickly cleaning off the tables) No, so far I have not been impressed by any of my Italian hotels, maybe it's culture thing? Next time I will definitely look for something else. It could also be that you get what you pay for, but, on the other hand, this was not THAT cheap.....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: lindahagenmiller
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night in Rome at the Montreal, a disaster. In desperation, we started walking, wandered into Mondail, got a AAA rate just a few Euros higher than the creepy Montreal and settled into bliss on the newly renovated fourth floor. Cool, quiet, spacious, big bathroom, comfy bed, plenty of storage space, wifi, and generous breakfast of meat, cheese, eggs, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc. Staff is fantastic -- no language problems and they arranged a 3 am pickup for us to get to our early flight. Fantastic location around the corner from Piazza del Republica and the metro. Try it. You'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent séjour !”
Reviews.Author: SamNorman
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel. Service was very good, I had nothing to complain with. Receptionists are caring, at your disposal 24/7, rooms are comfortable and most of all, it is very well located, at a short walking distance from Termini and near most touristic areas. I recommend this hotel which is far more better than some best westerns in France where I'm from...!

Reviews.Title: “Good Functional Hotel, Friendly English-Speaking Staff”
Reviews.Author: dlaw51
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel located near the central train station. It's close enough to walk with your bags, but not so close that you hear the trains. The staff spoke perfect English and was very friendly. The breakfast was good, and the location is great. Pretty good sized rooms for Italy, nice bathroom, AC. Internet in the rooms did not work for me.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel that will enhance your stay in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: doilybug
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mondial was the third hotel we stayed at during our first visit to Rome and the only one we had not booked in advance. There had been a mix-up with one of our reservations and so we had to find another hotel at the last-minute for our final night. Having previously stayed in the area, we knew it would be a good location to revisit central Rome and easily get back to Termini station for the journey back home. Apart from the great location (most top attractions are within a good walking distance), there are not many pros to this hotel. The staff at the front desk were friendly. We chose Hotel Mondial because we recognised the brand and the lobby area was well presented, if not slightly dated. The room was clean, but basic and I would not have wanted to stay any longer than we needed to. It was my best night's sleep in Rome, but that might be attributed more to how tired I was as my partner could not say the same. When I woke the following morning, I realised that the rooms were not sound-proof and we could hear every word of the family in the room next to ours. There are many hotels in the local area and I think it would be wise to compare prices and Trip Advisor reviews before booking.

Reviews.Title: “OK but definitely not 4 starts.”
Reviews.Author: Keson123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in April. The hotel is OK but rather tourist class than 4 stars. I would say 3 at most - and for 3 starts it would be really good. 4 star rating makes the overall picture disappointing. The location is very good - close to the Termini train station, just around the corner from Republica underground station and basically within a walking distance from a lot of tourist attractions. The lobby makes a good impression and the staff is friendly. And this is where the fairy tale ends. The room I stayed in was very small with a tiny bathroom. I am a small guy and it was not very comfortable so I can imagine that big guys would *really* have a problem fitting in the shower cabin. The was no air conditioning! the staff explained that it is too early in the season!!! This definitely not something you would expect in a 4 star hotel. Also the minibar was locked :-( The breakfast was a very modest choice to say the least. In general this is a good tourist class hotel - 2 maybe 3 start at most.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, excellent service, breakfast OK.”
Reviews.Author: dfleming3
Reviews.Content: We're a young couple who wanted a decent hotel, not too expensive, for a city break, and this wasn't far off the mark. Rooms were clean although the decor was a little old. They were renovating parts of the hotel during our stay but this didn't cause us any inconvenience. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was OK, a wide variety of food but I didn't rate the bacon, egg and sausage, but I guess it's the same anywhere in Europe. Cereal, pastries, coffee, juice etc were all spot on though. Good location, Colosseum 15/20 mins walk, Spanish Steps ~30min walk, Vatican ~45min walk or Republicca metro stop is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th stay at the Mondial - they must be getting it right!”
Reviews.Author: Prop
Reviews.Content: I last reviewed the Mondial in March 2007 and said that we would stay there again. Well we have - in 2009 and again last week. The good bits remain the same. We think it is in a good location by the Opera House, just off Via Nazionale and round the corner from Piazza Republica. It is well away from the seedier parts of Termini. Whether you consider it far from the main tourist sights depends on how happy you are to walk. Rome is a compact city and we never use any transport other than our own feet to explore it on our stays. One of the joys of Rome is that you can be wandering down a narrow alley and you turn a corner to be confronted by a beautiful church or a delightful little piazza. The Colosseum is about 15 minutes south of the Mondial, the Trevi Fountain about 15 minutes west and the Spanish Steps possibly about 25 minutes North West. I am sure there are hotels nearer these sights, but suspect you would have to pay for the privilege. Breakfast at the Hotel is decent and functional. This has never bothered us as another joy of Rome are all the snacking opportunities from the little street cafes and gelaterias. The hotel room decor has always been a bit spartan. On our most recent visit we were pleasantly surprised to see that the rooms have been renovated and were plusher than before, although I suspect may not match everyone's idea of 4 star quality. Nevertheless the rooms are a good size for a city hotel and very clean. The bathrooms have also been renewed and are a good size and spotlessly clean. I am not sure if all the rooms have been upgraded as yet but this work has made the Mondial even better in my view. I mentioned the Gigolo restaurant down the Via Torino in my last review in 2007 and note I said it was good value at 100 Euros for two. Well, it has now been trumped. Since our last stay a new restaurant has opened, literally next door to the Mondial. This is called "Cotto" and it was truly wonderful. I have posted a separate review for the restaurant but a two course meal for two with a good bottle of wine cost us 90 Euros, which was really good value given the quality of the food. The lovely deli and wine bar Enoteca Chirra Goffredo Chirra is the Mondial's other neighbour that is well worth a visit. Just be careful not to knock over the Nebuchadnezzar of champagne on display as it may make a dent in your holiday budget! We will be back to Rome again and will keep staying at the Mondial.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, fairly priced”
Reviews.Author: kostyalevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mondial on two separate occasions on February 2011. The hotel is located just off via Nazionale, near the opera, the Quirinale, and about a 20 minute walk from the historical city center. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance, but no real night life, so it's a relatively quiet neighborhood. The hotel itself is fairly old. It hasn't been renovated in a while, something it sorely needs. The A/C controls seem unchanged since the 70's. However, the staff is very friendly, the rooms are spacious, and the the bathrooms comfortable. During my first stay I stayed in a double room, and during my second stay in a single room. Both were fine. The lobby also has a very old-world opulent feel to it. The hotel was attractively priced, which let me forgive its shortcomings. They also offered breakfast, but it wasn't anything special. I preferred to go in one of the many bars around there where you can get a cappucino and a chocolate croissant for under 2 Euros. The hotel has internet for the usual exorbitant prices. There is a garage next to it that curiously doesn't belong to the hotel. However, it is very convenient, albeit expensive at 25 Euros a night. All in all, the Mondial is not bad if it is attractively priced compared to other hotels in the area, such as the Raffaelo (best choice, but usually more expensive), or Eurostars International Palace (good hotel, but usually overpriced). When I stayed there, the Mondial was 25 Euros cheaper than International Palace and 35 Euros cheaper than the Raffaelo, so selecting the Mondial was a no-brainer. On other occasions, all three hotels were more or less at the same price level, and in that case I'd choose the Raffaelo.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied - all nine people”
Reviews.Author: nicex
Reviews.Content: We reserved the rooms directly in a hotel. All was O.K. The reception was very helpful. The hotel is very good situated. Metro is around the corner. cca 100m. But you can walk anywhere you want. One day we walked from the hotel to the Vatikan. Around the shops and around all well known historic sights. Our 5 rooms were quiet., clean. The brekfast was standard good.. I reserved the hotel for my frends and I was afraid, because I didnt know this hotel before.. But the whole group was very satisfied. The wifes as well. We had 4 double rooms and one single.

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Very good breakfast. Not very close to tourist attractions, but metro is 2 min walk. Don't leave money in safe!”
Reviews.Author: Italia01
Reviews.Content: 1. Breakfast is very good and nourishing. Tea/ coffee/ juice/ water/ milk. Bacon, eggs, ham, cheese, fruits, cornflakes, buscuits, croissants. Everyshing is fresh. 2. Good staff. Always ready to help. 3. Kettle in the room - a great idea!You can take in from barman. 4. Room service is okay, everything was clened properly. 5. Our room was nice, but the walls and the ceiling are a bit dirty and old. The doors and the furniture (especially wardrobe) aren't modern - but still very clean. The rooms need to be somehow renovated. However they really were making some renovations in the hotel during our stay, but there were no disturbing and no noise. The bed linen is clean and new. I didn't like the pillow - one was too "thin", and the other was too 'thick' - but it depends on the taste ;). The beds were orthopedic and weren't hard at all. It was warm and comfortable in the room. The hotel is situated on the quiet street - so no noise during the night. 6. I've read in one of the reviews at booking.com that the location is not so close to all the tourist's attractions, especially shops - absolutely agree! All the good shops near via del Corso, via Frattina, via Condotti are not less than 25-30 minutes walk by foot. The great advantage of this hotel is metro station Repubblica, so that you can get to the centre of Rome withing 5-10 minutes (for example, to Flaminio, Spagna, Ottaviano (Vatican). Also you can take a bus to get to the centre. The bus stop is 5-10 min walk. 7. We didn't find any good restaurant near the hotel. I guess Termini district is not a place where you can find a good restaurant. But in the centre there're some very good. 8. Termini train station is really 10 minutes walk. 9. KEEP AN EYE ON YOUR MONEY! Don't leave the money even in the safe deposit-box in the room!!! The staff in the hotel have the security code to every safe deposit-box, so it can be easily open. Also don't leave the valuable things like jewelery or even bijouterie in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SammyH79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend for my partner's birthday and we were not disappointed! The hotel is so close to the train station so we decided to catch the Leonardo Di Vinci Express from the airport (cost 14 euros) and then walk to the hotel (about 8 mins walk). When we arrived the staff were very welcoming and provided us with the name of a restaurant close by that served good food. The next day was my partners birthday and the staff were very helpful in making a reservation at an upmarket restaurant for dinner. As it was his birthday they assisted with the special requests that I had and made sure it was all kept secret from him. Cannot thank them enough as this was the best night out we had!! My partner loved it. The Ristorante Massimo D'azeglio is definately worth a visit as the food is outstanding!! The breakfast is continental but more than enough choice and we filled up every day. Rooms were cleaned every day while we were out and the towels were changed daily. I am quite particular about this and was not disappointed with the cleanliness of the rooms. The location of the hotel is fantastic. All the sights are close by apart from Vatican City and we walked everywhere to see it all. Also the shops near by are fab and well worth a trip to if you want some bargains. Shops further away were more pricey. Only one complaint and that is the price of the drinks in the bar and the cost of the mini bar. We had them put onto the room tab and was presented with a big bill at the end. 20 euros for 2 vodka and cokes does seem overpriced but I would still recommend this hotel. We had an amazing time!!

Reviews.Title: “After a stay at Hotel Canada, this was hell!”
Reviews.Author: frantica
Reviews.Content: Using Rome as a base touring Italy, we've stayed in several Roman hotels. A week prior, we stayed at Best Western Canada Hotel (three star) and we're quite happy. We thought we would step up to the four-star Mondial. It was a quick slide to hell! How this hotel has a four star rating is a mystery (or they're paying off someone). The rooms are dark and very outdated. Don't be fooled by the decorated lobby. The TVs are remnants from the Soviet Union. Breakfast was the worst in Italy, A Italian hotel serving instant coffee is....well, that in itself is enough to make anyone choose another hotel. The bathrooms might as well have squat toilets. That's how outdated this place is. If you don't book on the internet, don't expect free WIFI. Don't expect anything here...go somewhere else and have a better stay. Try Hotel Raffaello.

Reviews.Title: “worst best western i ever saw. not even 2 star!”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed A
Reviews.Content: We reserved 4 nights at the Best Western Mondial thinking that we dont want to take any chances with our hotel stay. This was the worst choice possible. The rooms are worse than college dorms. Cheap furniture and nasty pink walls. The carpet is dirty and full of stains. We reserved a double room and ended up with 2 twin beds pushed side by side. we also got 2 separate small blankets and those got replaced after we complained multiple times and finally got a big blanket. The beds are so uncomfortable the mattresses are like bricks. it was supposed to be a romantic stay and i cant even explain how far it was from that. The tv in the room is 15 years old although the pictures were different. When we mentioned that to the reception they said the pictures taken were from another best western. The furniture is so ugly and it seems like it hasnt been renovated since the 70s. The reception area is slightly nicer than the rooms and its deceiving in that sense. Breakfast is also mediocre. overall the hotel is such a bad choice and i wouldn't recommend it to anyone. avoid at any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GlendaN56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short distance from Rome's Termini railway station. It is excellent value for money with a good buffet breakfast included in the room rate which was very competitive. We stayed here for 4 nights in mid November. The bathroom was spotless, the beds firm but comfortable and the staff pleasant. The hotel is well placed to visit all the "must see" attractions of Rome and its proximity to the main station is an added bonus. There are plenty of restaurants on the same street and in the adjacent streets as well as an excellent supermarket located on the lower level of the Termini. We had a room which overlooked the via Torino however the area is remarkably - either that or our jetlag was worse than we realised!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-Great hotel-Great staff”
Reviews.Author: CreteCrete1
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, great room on the 4th floor very tidy and clean great friendly staff. Prices in the bar a bit expensive. The best location in the city centre makes everything very easy an pleasant. Must visit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: palmspr_flyer
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and room was ready which is always a good break. Room on 5th floor with Queen size bed. The only problem I found was my bed pillows weren't very good. Almost flat; like sleeping without one! Thought it was strange when everything else in the room was very nice. Free Breakfast was excellent! Very pleasant breakfast room. Location of hotel was perfect. One block from Rome Metro Subway, and walking distance to Central Train Station. Very safe area to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: RCofCupertino
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean, bed was comfortable and the rest room also was spacious. WI-FI was fast and free, Had no problem using Slingbox to stream my DVR contents to my laptop. Breakfast was good, althought there was no variety. Hot dog sausage, eggs and ham, cearels, coffee, expresso and juices. The staff all spoke English and were very helpful. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a gem in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda756
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights the end of September. What a find! I have stayed in Rome before, always disappointed with service and cleanliness. The Hotel Mondial is in a fabulous location, only blocks to the train and bus terminal but on a quiet street. The front staff were incredibly helpful. Free WIFI, great breakfast, an added bonus was happy hour served in the lovely bar area. There is not a restaurant in the hotel, but you can order from the bar and they arrange with the restaurant next door to have a great meal brought to you. I wouldn't waste time searching for a better option, this hotel provided all and more. You can call them to arrange a private pickup at the airport as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with excellent staff but disappointing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: barcroft2697
Reviews.Content: Although located in the Termini area, the hotel is well located as a staring point for most of the most popular sites. Staff, especially at Reception and bar, are excellent. I found the lobby and lounge areas to be comfortable and attractively decorated. Rooms and baths were not spacious but were of decent size, and the mattress and pillow were the most comfortable I experienced during my 17 days in Italy. New windows did not provide much in the way of noise insulation unfortunately. The main disappointment was breakfast. It was adequate, but not up to four-star hotel standards (which is this hotel's rating), and I beieve that most of the other three couples with whom I was traveling agree. The hotel provided a fee-based computer terminal near the Reception desk; printing accomplished through the hotel's printer. A few doors away is a restaurant called del Giglio, which offers excellent food in a welcoming ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: murattizo
Reviews.Content: Great location! However, the elevators are awfully slow! I mean it takes forever. To top it all off, one of the two elevators was out of order the day I checked out. Some of the rooms are not renovated and although I supposedly stayed in one of the renovated rooms (facing the back alley and ventilation system) I thought €150/per night wasn't justified. I had to wait in line to get breakfast (first time since college) due to the dimensions of the room where the breakfast was served. Staff not too friendly, kept arguing with each other in front of guests.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: neilaw
Reviews.Content: So, as I booked a 4 star hotel I was expecting a good level of accommodation and service. For starters the hotel is well located, we walked everywhere, didnt need to get the Metro once, but we do like walking. We walked all the way to the Vatican on one of the days, which takes about 90mins. Trevi fountain is about 20mins walk, there is a lovely plaza round the corner and you are just off the Via Nazionale which runs to places like the Forum etc, so location is good. The lobby is fine, a bit OTT and bling but clean and tidy if not a tad dated. The checkin staff were pleasant, no issues there and the staff in general were professional. The room was a disappointment, this is supposedly a four star hotel. The rooms decor was extremely dated and had been touched up badly, to the point where someone had overpainted the bottom of TV in a nice red colour where they had been painting the shelf, which just makes things look a bit shoddy (For staff reference this is room 111 by the way). The room itself was very clean so top marks to the cleaners, but didnt feel like a four star experience, dingy, old decor, not much in the way of nice touches. The bed was hard and one wafer thin pillow each. The breakfast is inlcuded in the price and to be honest I can see why, you would feel cheated if you had to pay for it. 3 hot items, hot dog sausages (??), bacon fat (I challenge anyone to spot meat on them, guess thats why that section never ran out) and burnt scrambled egg, not really what I would call 4 star. Toaster you do yourself with small sliced stale bits of white bread, in fact all of the rolls on offer where stale. Could be much better, arent we in Italy one of the places renowned for good cuisine? The thing is, if this hotel was only say £100 per night then maybe you could forgive its shortcomings, buts its over £150 per night!!!! only reason to recommend is due to location

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious room”
Reviews.Author: GVS40
Reviews.Content: Had a four day getaway with young kids. Room was huge! More space than we ever expected from a hotel in central Rome. Very modern and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location, clean, large bathroom, expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: hotigloos
Reviews.Content: great location: 10 min walk from termini train station, around the corner from republica metro step and bus line 64 stop. nice hotel, nice staff, clean, good breakfast high ceilings good size bathrooms safe large enough for laptop dislikes: no kleenex beds a little hard AC could have been colder, didn’t work breifly one night internet is 15 euros per day. Very expensive. Other hotels charge by hour or free. Paid 100 euros/night in july 2010 stayed 4 nights, booked on orbitz, paid at hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BullyBeefBill
Reviews.Content: We drove to Rome from Lake Garda as part of a 3 week tour of Italy and France. I was expecting total gridlock but the streets were very quiet and we arrived at the Hotel about 20 minutes after leaving the motorway. We had a space reserved in the Hotel’s car pack which is at the rear. At 30 euros a night, it’s a bit expensive but it saved a lot of hassle. Note, if you planning to reserve a space, you must ring the hotel just prior to arrival so they can inform the authorities of your number plate as the Hotel is just inside a restricted area. The Hotel itself is in a great location for exploring Rome with major attractions being within a 15 minute walk. We had 2 nights in a triple room and whilst the Hotel lobby and its “Superior” rooms (as shown on the website) are certainly 4 star, I would rate the standard rooms as being more 3 star. Having said that, the room was clean , very adequate and spacious. You couldn’t hear any traffic (it’s a fairly quiet street anyway) and the air conditioning was great. Breakfast was continental style and there was ample to choose from. We ate the first night in the Coto restaurant next door but it was bland and expensive. As we had been to Rome before, the next night we jumped in a cab and headed over to the Trastevere area (7 euros) where you get the best food in Rome at great prices. I would recommend this Hotel for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean - Just Don't Complain About Anything!!”
Reviews.Author: Esperanza_7
Reviews.Content: Transfer from airport to hotel - arranged by Valentino (front desk) excellent. New room on 5th floor was very nice but small for a 10 night stay. Asked at reception if there was a possibility of changing for something a bit bigger. They said we had one of the new rooms and the hotel was fully booked, so could do nothing until Monday. We were also told the bigger rooms were older and not so nice. We decided to stay where we were but were not contacted or offered any viewings of other rooms on the Monday. Room, though small, was new, modern, very nice with good design, lighting, air con, etc. No view but a quiet position and no smoking, as we requested. Coffee making equipment was an added bonus. Room was kept spotlessly clean by our two very nice housekeeping ladies. Buffet breakfast was fairly standard and fresh. The self service coffee/tea machine made a really good cappuccino! The Bar – we only had one experience there! Inexperienced barman who tried to convince my husband that Punt y Mes was the Campari and Tonic he ordered! Another wrong drink later and bottle viewing, it turned out that he didn’t know what Campari was! My glass of undrinkable red wine also had to be changed. Our guest’s Sprite was fine!! When we complained about all this at the front desk (rather embarrassing in front of our guest) it was treated with indifference and no apology. My husband finally settled for a ‘gin and tonic’. One mixer drink, one medium glass of red wine and one soft drink – 20 Euros!! The majority of the front desk staff need to be more than just polite. You were lucky to get any form of greeting and smiles were very few and far between. I think once we complained about a couple of things they didn’t like it. Staying for 10 days things are more noticeable. For me, the final point was on departure day. As our flight left at night we asked if a later check out might be possible. We were very grudgingly told that we could keep the room till 12 noon instead of 11am! (12 noon was the check out on our Best Western confirmation anyway!!) At 12.01 just as we were leaving the room – the phone rang and it was the reception calling to make sure we were checking out!! We found this extremely bad mannered and could have understood a call if by 12.15’sh we had not appeared at the reception. The good things for us about this hotel was its cleanliness and amazing location, which I have to say was perfect. It is accessible to everything with the greatest of ease, including trains, metro, buses, trams, shopping, restaurants, sightseeing, etc. Two particular restaurants which we found to be very good were the La Taverna dei Monti and the Taverna Parione. I will be posting reports on them over the next week or so. Unfortunately, several restaurants we were hoping to try were closed for holidays. If you have the time and possibility, try and get to Tivoli (amazing fountains) and also to the ruins at Ostia Antica (wear trainers!!) This was our 3rd visit to Rome and I’m sure it won’t be our last. We will also not be deterred from booking Best Western in the future as we have had many excellent experiences with them in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JackH_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - but not just because it's very close to a Metro station, and the train station, as others have mentioned. It's just down the street from the magnificant Santa Maria Maggiore - one of the 4 patriarchal basilicas in Rome. Also - the Plaza della Republica with its great fountains (where the metro station is) is literally around the corner. Facing it is the basilica of Santa Maria degli Angeli, which is built within the remains of Diocletian's Baths! There are numerous great restaurants within a 15 minute walk, and the hotel is also just off the Via Nazionale - a great street for shopping and people watching. (Check out the George Byron bistro just a block down for great hospitality and a good beer selection at the end of the day.) As for the hotel itself, the lobby areas are nicely done, the rooms are clean and well appointed. I don't quite understand all the references to the rooms being large. They're adequate, and ok by European standards, but they're hardly large. The breakfast was good and it carried us all day until dinner. The quality of service seems to vary with the personel on shift. I don't think I saw the same crew twice over the week we were there. Some were helpful, others not. But overall - this hotel is great value. We'd go back and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location great food right next door”
Reviews.Author: ElLocoCanadains
Reviews.Content: What can i say its very well located, clean , and all you need in rome step out side turn right and the first restaurant you see is called COTO i think but its great ask for Mario say the crazy Canadaians sent ya lol hes great and the food was great we ate there 3 times!! once you find a good place to eat your best to stick with it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DB_Montreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good enough for our comfort. Not the best in my life by good enough, Like most European hotels we did not expect to have the same level of service of standard American 4 stars hotels. This hotel was clean and room size was perfect. Free breakfast was similar to other European hotels we've done in Europe (poor setup but good food). Do not expect American food in Europe...it is another country folks! Change your mind and attitude once there. Great location. It is close to several major Roma attractions and walking distance to subway. Good restaurants around too. Please do not plan to have a car in Roma. No packing just about anywhere and crazy drivers ...:-) We did not...and enjoyed walking the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We had two rooms beside each other on the 5th floor. The rooms were very clean especially the bathrooms. The rooms were spacious and we were able to check in early which was greatly appreciated. The breakfast was excellent and overall I was very happy with our experience at this hotel. My only complaint was that the airconditioning didn't work very well in one of the rooms. It just barely took the edge off the stifling heat. The other room was fine. I liked the location as it was easy to get to the places we wanted to visit. There are also lots of little take out restaurants closeby where you can buy drinks or snacks. It is a good home base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: enu1hrab
Reviews.Content: We caught the Leonardo Express from Fiumcino Airport (Euros 14.00 per person) to the Termini Station and the Mondial is literally 10 mins walk from there. This is a lovely, comfortable hotel which is was pleasurable to return to each evening, and was much better than we were expecting, having booked through Air Miles. Our room was on the third floor to the front and a very good size. The hotel is in a side road, which can get busy at times, but keep the shutters and double glazed windows closed, with the air-contitioning on, and you won't hear a thing. If you want tea/coffee facilities in your room, you only have to ask and there is no charge! The Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps and Coliseum are within one mile (we walked everywhere, except for the Vatican (catch the number 64 bus from Via Republica - 1 Euro each way)). The hotel is situated next door to a trendy restaurant on one side and a delicatesseb/bar/eaterie on the other (very nice). Further along is a very nice looking restaurant (a little bit pricier) which seemed to be popular. Breakfast was extensive, with all the usual hot and cold selections. Same menu each day, but so what? There was enough variation to have something different each day. I recommend the croissants. All in all we were more than happy with the hotel and service we received and would definitely recommend this hotel for a very enjoyable stay in Rome. If we return to Rome, we would stay there again. Just a word of warning though - keep your valuables in the hotel safe and take jus t what you need for the day. Despite all the warnings, my husband still managed to have his wallet stolen!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, fast internet, pretty good location, modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: EvaninCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and it was a great hotel (friends of mine just left for Italy and I told them to stay here). It is close to the train station and the station for city buses, making it easy to get anywhere in the city. Our room was very large and comfortable. We had a room facing the street and it was quiet. Some of the front staff were very friendly, others not so much (but that tended to be how it was everywhere in Italy). They directed us to some great areas of town for dinner we would not have known about otherwise. The continental breakfast was okay - better than most in Italy but still lower than what we would expect in North America. The free high speed wireless was fast and reliable, but you have to get a new code daily. There is a "do not disturb" switch at the head of each bed that turns on a light outside your door. We were not aware of this, and one of us hit it accidentally, resulting in our room not being cleaned that day. Minor thing. Now you know.

Reviews.Title: “Andrea and Valentino rock!”
Reviews.Author: joyceandpat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at this hotel in rather a state of stress. Andrea and Valentino who were at the front desk at this time did everything possible to accommodate us. They were most kind and gracious throughout our entire stay, attending promptly and courteously to all of our needs. Our compliments to Hotel Mondial for having the good sense to employ two such competent young men. Because of them, we will be considering hotels in the Best Western chain for our future travels. Helen McGawley

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dublingirl18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mondial hotel for 4 nights, upon my arrival I was greeted by the most beautiful lobby, quite stunning. The gentleman at reception was very pleasant & spoke perfect English so I was glad. Our room as available even though I arrive early. My room was on the 2nd floor, It was a triple room, very spacious, very clean. It had 3 beds rather than a double & single, but that was perfect. the bathroom was large, the lock on the bathroom door stuck first go so that could have been a disaaster had someone been on thie own. However the housekeeping lady I spoke to had the lock fixed the very next morning so it was fine. There was a mini bar, satelite TV, not many English speaking channels (maybe 2). There was a safe provided in the room. The beds were not comfy & the pillows were like rocks, so I didnt have the best nights sleep. Breakfast was buffet style, good selection of cereals, fruit, scrambled eggs, sausages (hot dog style), bacon, juices, yogarts, toast and breads. The location was great, the hotel is steps from Via Nationzale & Republica where you can get the Hop On Hop Off bus (which I recommed) there are plenty of restaurants in the area & a really delicious Ice cream Parlor right next door!!! Overall this is a great hotel in a good safe area, also in walking distance to the Termini station, I would recommend this hotel & I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge not warm and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Okied0kie
Reviews.Content: We were asked to check-in at 2:30 pm when the website says that the hotel's check-in time is at 2:00 pm.... that may be not such a big deal but for tired travellers from Paris, 30 minutes it a whole lot of time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wadi
Reviews.Content: 80Euros/night for a superior single room w/ bathroom (no bathtub - but excellent hot shower, great pressure - a real treat after a day in Rome). Comfy bed and pillows, room temp just right. Sat color TV with CNN, BBC and local stations. Internet in the room $. Complimentary kettle w/tea and nescafe at no extra charge - a nice touch. Generous closet space w/hangers. A full rich buffet breakfast is served at 6:45am every morning in a small cosy breakfast room - including mineral water, juice, and cappuchino - I looked forward to it every morning. Service is excellent - speedy check in and out, Free luggage storage. Pics of the hotel at bestwestern.com are true to life photos. I would definitely stay again. Prime location - Via Torino at Via Nazionale - right at Piazza Repulicca. 2 blocks from Termini Rail Station/Airport Express Train 15Euro - one way). Close to Quirnale, Barberini Museum, The Four Fountains and Trevi Fountain. Walking distance to Colosseum/Palantine Hill/Roman Forum, Piazza Venezia. Lots of shopping, restaurants, cafes, gelaterias, Tobacco and Wine shops. Grocery store - Gespar - within walking distance on North side of Via Nazionale. Stayed 5 nights, very safe hotel, and better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike1227
Reviews.Content: Staying one night in the Hotel Patria on the same street, we booked the Hotel Mondial last minute since we needed another day in Rome. And we were very pleased with this hotel. The rooms are big and have alot of space to move about and the bed was comfortable. Good size bathroom with large tub. Location was great, very close to the metro and the train station as well. All of this with a $50 cheaper price tag than the first hotel. The breakfast was included and we loaded up. It had the normal breakfast materials of Europe, cakes and crossiants, etc. They did have scrambled eggs, but my gf said they were just okay. Needless to say, this was the better stay for us in Rome. It is a great price for a nice clean room near the metro and the train station

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Victor534
Reviews.Content: After twice a year month long trips to Italy and staying at 3 - 5 star hotels, this is our pick for the best value hotel. Large, comfortable room on fourth floor with modern furnishings. A climate control system that really works and is controllable in the room. Great location on a relatively quiet street. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast. All for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: randyg1124
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hidden gens in Rome. The staff was very nice and the service was excellent. Everyone was very helpful for check-in to check-out (4 Nights). I upgraded to the 4th floor. The room was very large (approx 300 sq/ft) with 12 ft ceilings, everything was very clean. The 4 floor was just remolded and just came available 2 weeks prior to our stay. The room also had a small balcony which nice to go out on in the morning and evenings. This hotel is a very good base for Rome, 5 blocks from the Train Station and 1 block from the metro. I have stayed in many hotels in Europe and I would rate this hotel one of the best for under $200 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mondial ...from Hell.”
Reviews.Author: elFlaco1953
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 5 months in advance requesting an in-room bath and air conditioned. To our surprise the was no air conditioned in the hotel up to June 1st and we were not informed that this was a City regulatory order. When we complained, hotel staff just didn't care and did not call the management when we requested. As a plus sign they did provide a fan when we said we were going out the door. On top of that, the room was not cleaned completely, nor the towels were changed daily contrary of what it was advertised. The drunks at the bar next door and the street were very noicy even with the window closed. Romans like to blow their car's horn for almost anything. Best Western said there was nothing they could do. This hotel deserves a 0, zero! star rating. They ruined my Rome vacation. O. Galloso Miami, FL

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service, loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: retired1010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, front desk service was excellent, especially Natalia. She was extremely helpful , and answered all our many questions with a smile! The room was a good size, everything was very clean, and we totally enjoyed our stay. No problem getting extra towels or pillows. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and wanted to help. Great place to stay and a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Blossom14153
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a great base to see Rome as it is about a 2 minute walk from the nearest metro station Repubblica, which is also one stop away from Termini central train station which has direct links to the airport.
