Also directly in front of the hotel is a place where you can change your money, and there are lots of resturants, a pharmacy, shops and a supermarket located close by. The hotel itself is a charming, decent sized hotel (about 5 floors) with very friendly helpful staff who spoke english very well. The rooms are a decent size, which mabye a little small for some people, but as we were only using it to get ready in the mornings and for sleep, it served us just fine! Our room had a television, a big table with 2 chairs and a big mirror (which came in handy when 2 girls are getting ready in the morning!) and a comfortable queen sized bed. The bathroom was clean, powerful shower/bath tub, which had an alarm cord which would be useful for anyone who fell in the shower, and also came with plenty of clean towels and additional toiletries (nail file, cotton buds, shower jel, shower cap, shampoo etc...). Breakfast was decent enough - cereals, crossiants, bread roles, cheese, jam, butter, yoghurt, fruit, bacon, eggs, and all the usual morning drinks! the best thing to eat in the morning was the crossiants when they are freshly laid out :D The only one negative thing I could think of to say is that even though the hotel does have a internet point located in the lobby, to use the computer for about an hour was something like 15 euros! We felt this was a wonderful hotel and would not hesitate staying here again if we were to return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MikeDenmark
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for metro, railwaystation and within walking distance of most sights Old fashioned interior decor - early eighties Simple breakfast. Dont expect too much Friendly and helpful staff at the reception Room is only somehow clean Scary and old elevator Hard beds Not worth much more than EUR 100 / night The reception will print you a voucher for a free drink at the next door restaurant. Its a glass of limonade and a quite expensive restaurant

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, friendly hotel in a great position for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPurley
Reviews.Content: Hotel was friendly, helpful, had good clean comfortable rooms and a breakfast buffet. Well placed for eating out and visiting the sites in centre of Rome. Very near Termini Railway Station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LondonLianne
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter for a 21st birthday present for 4 days. Hotel very central, just 5 mins walk from Termini (opposite Opera House). Large, clean room. Good breakfast and helpful staff. You can walk to all the sights from here. Colosseum just 20 mins walk. Vatican City 45 mins walk. A couple of good cheap pizza and pasta restaurants within 5 mins walk, Est Est Est just off Via Nazionale and another one called 'The White Hen' (La G..... Blanca) just round the corner (left out of hotel, first left and then first right). Both get very busy and have good atmosphere. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lolstar6
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Rome after staying in The Mondial hotel. The hotel is located right next to the opera and about a five minute walk from the train station. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and offered a free luggage room to hold luggage after check out which is quite unuaual as most hotels charge. The rooms were basic but cleaned every day with fresh towels etc. There is a TV in the room with only two english speaking channels which was surprising for a four star hotel catering for different nationalites, although we obviously dont spend all our holiday watching TV it is nice to have backround noise while getting ready etc.. There is also no tea or coffee facilites in the room, not being big tea drinkers this wasnt really a problem for us but it may be for big tea and coffee drinkers. The bed was a little hard with only two pillows but after asking for more staff happily obliged. The walls however are very thin and you can almost hear peoples converstaions in the next room! Breakfast was always pleasant with a lot to offer, eggs, bacon, croissants and cereals, more then enough to feel you up till lunch! When you arrive the receptionist will give you two vouchers for two free drinks at the restaurant next door, if you want my advice you wont even bother going. The restaurant looks posh but is completly unimpressive. After unpacking we decided to go and get our free drinks, as soon as we walked in we were shown to a table, we hadnt planned to eat in the first place we saw but being hungry we decided to give it a go. Literally 3 minutes (no exageration) after ordering "the pasta of the day" we were given two bowls of luke warm pasta tossed in a bit of pesto. As our first meal in a city like Rome this was extremley disappointing but fortunately we found most roman restaurants arnt like this. Our "two free drinks" were two small glasses of a pink sickly fruit concotion, not-as we were led to believe-our own choice in drinks. Ironically this was the most expensive place we went to! When the receptionist gives you these two free tickets at the hotel, your'd be wise just to give the place a miss. The best places to eat are usually the small back street places where locals eat. Try La Pizzeria de Ricci, a small resturant about 5 minutes walk from the hotel, extremley busy but your'll see why once you eat there. Overall the mondial is a pleasant and comfortable hotel and we enjoyed our stay but I would personally class it 3 star not 4.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel! great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: krista53
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to train & Metro station... offers an excellent diversified breakfast with the price. Our room was spacious, had internet that worked, large bathroom, quiet, elevators, has a hotel porter/bell-hop, beautifully decorated throughout. Great value for your money! Would stay there again ~ highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, good base for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: SimonOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Room was clean and compact and reasonably well equipped with a good safe etc. Breakfast was well replenished. 2 mins from Republika underground station and 20 mins walk to Trevi fountain it was a good base from which to travel. The only minus was when requested tea/coffee facilities in room this was refused even though the in room list of services said this would be provided on request. Notwithstanding this we would return to this hotel. I would recommend taking the train from the airport as it is a short walk from Termini to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: AbbeysMum
Reviews.Content: There were good and bad things about this hotel. Firstly, the location is good, being only 5 minutes walk from the Termini station and 2 minutes from the Metro. The room itself was spacious but quite basic and a little shabby. There was nothing to make it feel homely. The bed was large, hard and had only 3 pillows! We had to ask for another pillow and ended up with 5! In addition, there were no tea and coffee facilities in the room which, for a 4 star hotel, you do at least expect. We had to go to the bar and request these. They only supplied two milk cartons at a time and we had to go back three or four times for top ups. They also supplied horrible thin plastic cups, both of which split within seconds! Take your own plastic cups with you in your luggage for use by the bed if you want something decent to drink out of at night. The bathroom was clean and spacious and towels etc. replaced as required. The walls were a little thin and you could easily hear guests having a bath next door through the vents. All in all we would rate the room 3 out of 5. The breakfast buffet had a good choice with hot bacon (of a kind) and scrambled egg and frankfurter sausages. However there was a good choice of fruit, cereal and ham, cheese etc. plus croissants, cake and yoghurts. Certainly enough to stock you up for the day! The staff were friendly but wanted to charge us 2 euros for 15 minutes of wifi access which we thought was excessive. We had read reviews on this hotel and were aware that there had been thefts out of the rooms. Consequently we were very aware to always either lock things in our suitcase or take things with us. However, one day I had put my empty handbag in our case and had not locked the case as I did not think it was worth it, there being nothing of value in my bag. However, amazingly, 2 quite ordinary pens were taken from my handbag during the day and the case had obviously been looked in and moved. So beware! There is a safe in the room which we had used without problem. Just dont leave anything lying about that is precious to you. We did not think the hotel was really a 4 star hotel, more like a good 3 star. The hotel is a 30 second walk from the Via Nationale and the bus number 40 will take you directly to St Peters. Buses are one euro per trip and tickets are valid for 75 minutes either on the metro or bus after stamping (on the bus). All the major attractions are also within walking distance. The Trevi fountain at night is better than during the day and not so busy. it would also be a good idea to check if the Pope is due to give a mass at St Peters. We arrived and had to go away and come back as there was no access for another two hours. However, you can watch the mass on the big screens in the square. Eating out is very hit and miss but we found a great little restaurant within about 7 minutes walk from the hotel called Est Est Est. it is down a cul de sac off of the Via Genova. We came upon it by chance and it is busy with italians, always a good sign! It is very reasonably priced and has a great atmosphere. You may have to wait for a table at busy times but tables can be reserved. We reserved a table on our last night and were treated like regulars with complimentary pastries and coffee. A 3 course meal for two is about 40 euros, including wine! Well worth a visit! Do not go into the restaurants close to the main attractions. We went into one for a coffee opposite the colosseum, mainly to warm up! It cost us 7 euros for a sprite, 12 euros for 2 coffees and 8 euros for a small plain pizza. All in all, a bit of a rip off! Unfortunately, we had terrible weather. It rained every day and walking around the colosseum and the forum/palatine when it is cold and rainy is no fun! On the last day it snowed (the first snow in Rome for many years!) and the trains to the airport were a nightmare (and they only had an inch of snow!). A 30 minute journey by train to the airport took 2 hours! However, that was just bad luck. If you are expecting it to rain when you visit Rome then make sure you take an umbrella! Every street corner (and we mean EVERY!) has an umbrella salesman and you will be continually approached. If you dont want to be forever saying no then take your own! When the rain stops they then sell camera tripods! Rome is a great place for a short break but it is noisy with sirens and traffic in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, good location but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Moomin1087
Reviews.Content: overall i would say this is a 3 star hotel. Location, foyer and bar area are a definite 4 star however this is not reflected in the floors above. Some of the staff were very helpful all very polite but some were not very good. breakfast was lacking some what but the location of the hotel is spot on. Media system in the room was very good if a bit expensive. we will however forgive that some parts of the hotel were under refurbishment and updating. maybe the information in the room was a bit misleading as it stated that tea and coffee making facilities were available free of charge from the bar if you collected it if you don't there is a 4 euro charge. The hotel is literally round the corner from Republica Metro and a 10 min walk from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money & location”
Reviews.Author: AmazonMiami
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just cambe back from vacationing in Rome and we stayed at the Hotel Mondial on Via Torino. The hotel is perfect for vacation or business travel as it includes a great breakfast. The rooms are very comfortable and with all the necessary amenities. It is centrally located within walking distance to the Metro & Termini stations, shops and touristic places. The hotel Staff was fantastic, especially Rita, Valentino, Diego & Andreas. I recommend it highly. Thelma Alvarez

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: kitchenqueenUsa
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Christmas Day through News Years Day: The staff were amazing, very thoughtful and helpful. Their ability to translate to so many different languages made each guest feel very special. I especially appreciated how fluent their English was, even though my son spoke Italian. I felt very safe in the location and it was very convienent to everywhere else we went, I would stay here again and would recommend it to family & friends!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, efficient and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: AlannaIreland
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. From our arrival staff could not have been more pleasant to deal with, recommending visits, travel information etc. A terrific delicatessan/ cafe on the same street and close to termini train and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sven_Haworth
Reviews.Content: Only a 5 minute walk from the main railway station, this hotel was very clean, nicely decorated and the breakfast set us up for long days walking around Rome. All the sites are within walking distance. We din't use public transport once in the city centre. The price was reasonable for Rome. Don't use the "posh" restaurant next door though; mediocre food and surley service at extortionate prices! We found a much nicer pizzeria just off Via Nazionale which was packed out every night and servied excellent food for reasonable prices - can't remember the name though...

Reviews.Title: “perfect little place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vero L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Mondial for a quick weekend break and had a fantastic experience The hotel room was impeccable, the location was perfect and the staff totally outstandind and the breakfast divine!!! The front desk lady Rita made my trip a memorable experience, as she was able to call a local friend of mine whom I had lost contact for the past 12 years! Thank you Rita!! If you visit Rome, this hotel is the perfect place to stay in Rome, you are 3 blocks from the bus terminal and a block from the regular bus stop (take #64) and will bring you to the Colisseum and Vatican City!!! THe hotel is so well located that 1.5 blocks you will find the underground station and when you take it, if you go two stops down you will find Galeria Borghese, Spanish Steps, Via Conodotti. its a great place! enjoy Rome!! The Carriere's from Miami Florida

Reviews.Title: “Theft from room - be V.V. careful”
Reviews.Author: linzif
Reviews.Content: Left our 'big' camera in our locked room, was stolen - staff disinterested, all could say was 'need to go police' Our in room safe was so tampered with that we had to obtain the master key code to get into it!! Reading other reviews this is a REGULAR occurance here. Still trying to get some reimbursement, from hotel or Best Western? so won't say more....at this point in time. Will update with outcome later.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: CalGirlTravler
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us traveling together and my friend and I were the last to arrive. When we tried to check in were told the air conditioning was not working so they would have us stay at another Best Western several blocks away. We mentioned we really wanted to be with our friends and we were told they did not know when the air would be fixed. We were very disappointed but we walked several blocks away after traveling for 14 hours. Later that evening, we walked back to the hotel to meet our friends and discovered other people were being checked in. We asked if the air conditioning had been fixed and we were told no. Our friends said there was not a problem with air conditioning in their rooms. The next day my room mate called Best Western Headquarters and mentioned what had happened. Before you knew it there was a room available for us complete with air conditioning. The room was quite run down, dark and sad looking. After several days our stay in Rome was over. The 6 of us were on a van headed to a ship for a 12 day cruise. My friend noticed her watch, camera and Ipod were gone. She immediately called the hotel from the van and was told they would look for her things. When we got to the ship I found some of my things were stolen from me too and they would have had to go through my luggage to get the items. My friend called the hotel again and mentioned I was also missing items. They said they couldn't find her items and she would have to send them a letter itemizing what was gone and how much it was worth and they would turn it over to their insurance. To make a long story short, the hotel now refuses to reimburse us and Best Western International says they can't do anything about it. If you do choose to use this hotel, be sure to take the large hunk of metal off the key and take the key with you when you leave the hotel so they do not know you are gone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mondial is a clean modern hotel convenient to transportation and sites.”
Reviews.Author: darnellgd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Mondial four nights before embarking on a Mediterranean cruise for our 50th anniversary. We booked the hotel online through Best Western and had no trouble with our pre-paid reservation. The room with queen size bed was comfortable and quiet with a modern tiled bathroom with sink, shower, toilet, and bidet. Internet wireless or wired service was free but had to be arranged with the front desk daily in blocks of time. The service and food for the complimentary buffet breakfast were excellent. The bar offered a dinner delivery menu from a nearby restaurant which we did not use. Nor did we use room service. Drinks in the bar were average for Rome, about 5 euros. The bar was usually vacant. Too many other places in the neighborhood. The lobby restrooms were modern and spotless and the seating area was spacious and quiet. The two lifts were small, 4-5 persons max, but reliable, and big enough for wheelchair and companion. The hotel has parking in back which we did not use. We had dinner nearby two nights and took a taxi to others the other two. There is a friendly coffee and wine bar next door with sidewalk seating across from the Opera House. The hotel staff was very attentive and spoke excellent English, certainly better than my Italian. We would stay there again and will recommend it to our travel agent as a moderately priced, medium size, modern hotel in a convenient location near Plaza Republica and the Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Bri165
Reviews.Content: I am very particular about hotels - typically a Marriott or Westin is what I prefer. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It was clean, the room had a private bath that was a decent size - and it was air conditioned.. The location was great - was able to walk to see everything. And it was just a block or two from the tour bus office and train station. I felt very safe in the area. The only down side was the breakfast - it was ok - not great. There is a great resturant next door. The staff and food there were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: baccardimac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance from the train station, the subway, Trevi Fountain, Santa Maria Maggiore, etc. A good jumping point at a good price. Know your surroundings as the map the hotel provided can be deceiving (i.e. bring your own map and plan beforehand). The staff was helpful but this is a busy hotel so sometimes it feels rushed, especially on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Functional.”
Reviews.Author: Shabahoo
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. Reception staff excellent. Arranged taxis to and from airport. Breakfast was a buffet. Not too bad but not particularly good either. All in all value for money and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Do you want a good location, or a good room?”
Reviews.Author: AverageGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mondial for 4 nights in September. The location is excellent - just a few minutes walk from the train station, around the corner from the metro and from the hop-on hop-off bus stop and from McDonalds. About a 20 minute walk from the Colosseum and even closer to the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. The Hotel itself, however, is just average and wouldn't be 4 star by Australian standards. The room we were given was really small with 2 single beds, so we asked for a room with a double bed and got a room that was much larger, it was clean, but the decor is really old and tired. We could hear EVERYTHING going on in the next rooms and hallway which meant we didn't get much sleep - but if you're a heavy sleeper this probably won't bother you. If you want tea & coffee making facilities in your room you have to go down to the bar and get all the stuff yourself, and there is also limited room service. By this I mean you have to go down to the bar and order what you want instead of being able to pick up the phone. The staff were friendly enough, but not overly helpful or forthcoming as they were in other hotels. If you want a basic hotel in a good location then this is it. Just don't think of it as a hotel experience where you're happy to relax in your room as it's really more of a bed for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawnth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four night. Located in a great location. Its about 10 min walk from the termini train station. A 2 min walk from the Republica station which is one hop away on the metro from termini. tons of bus headed out to all sorts of locations in Rome stops nearby. Hotel overall is pretty average and staff is generally helpful. The room was generally quite which was surprising given how busy the area it is located tends to be.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: philAt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 days towards the end of August. My rating is a value for money rating based upon the price paid of £160 for 3 nights in a twin room. Location is quite good. It is a 10 minute walk from Termini so you don't need to worry about a taxi or underground. It takes about 15 minutes to get to the Colosseum. To get to the Vatican you walk around the corner to the underground station and take it a few stops. It is a little further out than some hotels but all in all the location is decent being at the 'right' side of Termini Station. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We didn't have any problems but what we asked of them they answered well. The room we had was of a decent size - a little bigger than your standard business 4* hotel in the UK, eg a Marriot. It could do with a revamp but it was extremely clean and the aircon was superb (it was extremely hot when we were there). The bathroom was decent and again extremely clean. There was a safe in our room. There was a TV in the room - only 3 English channels. There was double glazing and we heard no noise from the street (we were on the main st). Breakfast was decent enough as long as you stuck to the continental version. Hot food included hot dogs, scrambled egg and bacon (not too good). There was the normal selection of croissants, bread, ham, cheese, cake, fruit, yoghurts etc. Bearing mind Rome ain't cheap this will save you a few pounds. The communal areas were spacious and comfortable and very clean. I wouldn't say that the hotel is to my style (I prefer modern hotels) but it is still a decent hotel and for the price I paid an absolute bargain - just over £25 each per night! I did a bit of searching to get that price and what I found is that hotel search engines quote wildly differing prices, so shop around. If you need to leave bags after check-out then there is a secure storage area with a ticketed system.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but take care of your possessions”
Reviews.Author: Colin003
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is clean with a very nice seating and bar area. Our room was spacious and and clean although a little tired. It partcularly could have done with a repaint of the walls. A wall unit had obviuosly been removed leaving an impression of the outline and holes where it had been screwed to the wall. The room was equipped with a combination safe, which was free to use and a mini-bar which we did not use. The sheets were changed daily which was a nice touch. Breakfast was adequate with a mixture of cereals, fruit, croissants, toast, scrambled egg, bacon and frankfurters. The restaurant staff were pleasant. The main negative for us was that my daughter had two watches taken from our room. We did use the combination safe, however we omitted to put the watches within. If you stay at this hotel I advise you to put all your valubles in the safe. Rome itself was lovely and all attractions are within walking distance although be prepared to cover some distance. August was a little hot for sightseeing, temperatures being around 36 degrees C every day. Unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel due to the incident regarding my Daughter's watches.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: roaminggal29
Reviews.Content: My sister and I found the hotel quite easily from Termini station (just a short walk). Good location and quite quiet on a side street. Room was clean and plain but sufficient for our needs and the bathroom was very large and very clean. Air conditioning could have been stronger for us, but that seems to be the norm for all of Rome. Ended up getting the internet (in lobby) for free even after I was told it was 2 Euro for 15 minutes by one front desk person. Breakfast was free of course and quite adequate with friendly staff. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but......”
Reviews.Author: defa01
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks far better on the website that what it actually is. We booked a no smoking room and got stuck in a smoking room that smelt of stale smoke. The rooms themselves are average and no frills, definately needs an upgrade. Some of the staff were unfriendly at first,however slowly warmed to us over a few days. One bonus is its location. Walking distance to the Colosseum and Terminii train station. Certainly not worth the price we paid however. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate 3* hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: maturetraveler9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. The location is excellent on a quiet side street not far from train station. Can walk to most places and the metro station Republica is only steps away. Room size is adequate for a hotel in a large European city. However, the furnishing, carpet and decoration need major refurbishing. Bathroom is old and needs updating -- more like a bathroom for a 2 1/2* hotel. Services are average. Front desk staff will provide the necessary services or information when asked. They would not volunteer the free services per online reservation agreements e.g. internet, coffee. Breakfast is good and adequate. Overall, the hotel is not a 4* hotel but is quite adequate for non-discriminating travelers visiting Rome for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed, efficient,quiet, friendly, 3 star, great location”
Reviews.Author: unclebobs
Reviews.Content: Picked for location and value, all major sights within 45 minute walk (most only 20mins). Some trepidation as result of some of reviews. Spent lovely 5 nights, and 5 walking days seeing breathtaking Rome. Couldn't fault staff. All very helpful. Yes 3 star, not 4, but fine. Opera house 100m away, but saw Carmina Burana performed in St Paul's within the walls - mindblowing performance in fantastic setting 5 mins walk down Via Nazionale. Agree with one reviewer Cotto restaurant next door - friendly, relaxed, simply tasty food and lovely house wine. Did try farther afield - and DK guide recommended restaurants- disappointing compared with Cotto.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: hotfoot13
Reviews.Content: was a bit nervous due to some of the bad reviews but no worries whatsoever. average size clean room and bathroom a fantastic location 7 mins from termini sation and 2 mins from republic metro. walked everywhere ( colleseum, trevi, spanish steps)except the vatican. Take a hop on hop off bus 16 euros from kiosks to get birds eye view of Rome. Eat at est! est! est! on the via genova a few blocks away from hotel. lunch at a pizzeria cafe on the via milano was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good rooms, good price - GOOD!”
Reviews.Author: PhilWallace
Reviews.Content: This is a good 4 star hotel that is now due some refurbishment. We stayed at Mondial in 2003 and found it quite excellent - pristine rooms and bedlinen changed every day. The glory has faded a little but it is STILL a very good hotel that I would heartily recommend. It was very clean with a good buffet breakfast room. The rooms are fitted with personal safes and are quite spacious (we stayed in 413). On this occasion the bedlinen was changed every other day, but I'd say that's about the industry standard and perfectly acceptable. Our room was fitted with shower but no bath, which was acceptable to us but if you wish a bath (which we had when we previously stayed) it's worth specifying in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Winterbon
Reviews.Content: My wife & I and our 23 year old daughter spent a week at the hotel. It's a ten minute walk from Termini Station and 3 minute walk to Repubblica Metro and bus stops, so it's an ideal location for getting around. Daily buffet breakfast was nice, with hot and cold choices. Close to liquor store and great deli. Cotto Restaurant next door was excellent. Lots of shopping around the neighbourhood within easy walking/strolling distance, and several places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ADDINBROOKE
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, with great staff, very helpful, a bit pricey but ideal location for exploring the city

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: myfourkids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed in several different hotels during our 18 days in Italy. This was by far the worst. We had no other problems, complaints, complications etc until we stayed here. The biggest disappointment was that the rooms are not upgraded with a secure entry. it is still to old fashioned key on the key ring. So we had placed our do not disturb sign out and turned on the do not disturb light. However, an employee from the hotel enters our room for no reason as I am dressing as I just got out of the shower. I screamed and he immediately shut the door. I immediately called the front desk. The hotel clerk said she would look into it and return my call. We never got a return phone call, so my husband and I went to the front desk. The clerk stated that she was sorry but this happens alot with this employee and there is nothing that can be done. Then we it came to check out we were told that there was not record of our payment in advance and we owed 495.00 euro. I showed them the papers where we had made reservations and paid with our travel agent. They would not accept and we had to pay twice. We are still trying to get a refund and the hotel is VERY rude, obnoxious, and does not value customer service. There atmosphere is also bad. There are homeless people begging for food and money sleeping on the sidewalks outside the hotel. We arranged for an airport transfer from the hotel.. We were charged 50 euro. I plan to spread the word to everyone and inform them of the horrible hotel and lack of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “good location, not up to 4 star standards though”
Reviews.Author: corrado8
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel Mondial because of its Best Western affiliation and from the reviews i read it seemed to be well located. Hotel is very close to Termini station and within walking distance of the major sites and there are a couple of nice restaurants very nearby. Check in went OK hassle free. We were assigned room 301 which was very clean but definitely not up to 4 star standards - if anything it reminded me of a university dorm room. It was all rather basic and finished in a ghastly pink: pink walls, pink carpet, pink furnishings; pink desk etc. Internet you have to pay for, bathroom was big but nothing special. Our room looked out over the street (Via Torino) but be warned it gets pretty noisy from the constant traffic outside, and particularly on Via Nationale. Also room was a bit stuffy and we had to sleep with the windows open because the air-conditioning system wasn't working. Breakfast was fine, but the waiting staff were a bit over-eager and will lift your plate (finished or not) if you so much as take your eyes off it. They made me pay an additional 60 Euro when i was checking out because they said i didn't stipulate two guests per room - even though i booked and paid for a twin room on the Best Western website. Didn't fight with them because we were rushing for the train back to the airport. Overall good location but the rooms, while clean, are definitely not 4 star and other bits of the hotel look rather run-down (eg elevators). The Best Western affiliation I am convinced means very little - this is the third BW hotel I have stayed in with really inconsistent quality compared to say Marriott or Holiday Inn. Also, lack of air-conditioning I would find a MAJOR problem if I had to stay there in June or July, while traffic noise would be a problem if i were a light sleeper. Having been to Rome now, I would book elsewhere again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, fine hotel but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: acb5870
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mondial in Rome for 2 nights in November. There were certainly cheaper hotels but we paid the going rate for a 4 star hotel in Rome seeing as we wanted to have a really enjoyable and memorable trip. We weren't diappointed either, the hotel was pretty impressive inside, (you could see where your money went) and the location was great, right in the city centre. We didn't spend much time in the hotel obviously but for a bit of class etc it was just the job. Staff friendly enough too and breakfast lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sofa”
Reviews.Author: jwmrtd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights around Christmas; the lobby, staff and room was very good. Staff was more friendly than expected. The early check-in was also no problem (I suppose we were lucky). The location is good - halfway the train station and the real down town area. Quite a few restaurants and shops in the area around the hotel. The lobby bar has very comfy big chairs and sofa's!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service Clean Rooms Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: doggieglos
Reviews.Content: Hotel was central to all areas a daily bus/ metro ticket can be purchased for 4 euros, plenty of little tavernas around,without being too expensive. The hotel staff are friendly all it takes is a smile and you will get whatever you require, tea and coffee facilities in your room are free just ask, also slippers, face flannels and pillows. The breakfast is fine lots of fruit,yogs ,rolls, the normal fare available , just be pleasant, I even got some china cups for our tea to take to the room! They arranged a cab to the airport 55 euros, clean fast service. Stayed 3 days and did whirlwind tour of the sights , the Campo Fiori area is worth a visit for the cafe society and eating , the market is great and fab bakeries, walk across to the jewish sector and then catch a bus to St Petro. The Collesium area is awesome ,forum, near the Monument a Vittotio Emanuele, lots to see there. Spent 3rd day seeing the Trevi , Spanish steps, Piazza Popolo walked down the Via Corso, to the Pantheon, bus back to rest then out for the evening to your favourite spot. Enjoy ,if on a budget use side street cafes or have your coffee standing at the bar, keep walking!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Mondial”
Reviews.Author: BrummieSmithy
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the best western mondial for 3 nights 29th jan-1st feb. This was our second visit to rome and we were amazed at the cost of things. The poor exchange rate was probably to blame, but £50 in a taxi from Ciampino Airport i thought was a rip off. The hotel itself is located just off Via Nazionale and is in a great location. We arrived at 11.30am and were told check-in was midday which was fine, so we went for a stroll and came back at midday. The room still wasn't ready and were told 10-15 mins, nearly an hour later we were told the room was ready. The delay wasn't the end of the world but a bit annoying. The rooms were fine, we were in room 201 which had a large bathroom, tv, internet, safe etc, the beds were ok, a bit on the hard side but slept quite well. We asked for tea/coffee making facilities and picked them up from the bar. The plastic cups wern't great, china cups would have been better. The heating wasn't working at first and the rooms were cold, we rang down to reception and soon after a flick of a switch it was working fine. Breakfast was very nice, plenty of choice from sausage, bacon and scrambled egg to fruits, toast, bred rolls, yoghurts, jams, croissants, cakes etc. The staff were all polite and helpful. Overall we would definately recommend the hotel, it might need a touch up here and there but overall for the price it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MarianSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I had searched the Internet for weeks and found these reviews invaluable. I find it only fair to now add my own findings. Excellent central location to shops, bars, train and metro station. All major sites within easy walking distance. Hotel very clean and the lounge/bar area most comfortable. The bar man on duty was excellent company and couldn't be more helpful. The room was on the small side and we had to arrange some sort of one-way system to walk around the bedroom but it was not a problem for the small amount of time we spent in there!. The bed linen was changed every day but we did find the bed a little on the hard side. The bathroom was also small but very clean. There was no tea/coffee making facilities on arrival but one call to reception and it was delivered to our room. We had paid for breakfast and we had a large selection to choose from and it was very nice. All the staff were very polite and friendly and even arranged a courier taxi back to the airport . The only negative was the two very small and ancient lifts! Excellent value for money and would without a doubt return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: TigersfanHampshire
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the revews of this hotel, I was more than slightly concerned about what I would find on arrival. My concerns were wholly unfounded. The desk staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful, as well as being extremely efficient. Other members of staff - cleaners, porters, waiters etc., were equally friendly and polite. The room was immaculately clean, as was the bathroom, and linen was changed on a regular basis. Breakfast was perfectly adequate with a wide range of dishes on offer, although the bacon was rather undercooked for my taste. Excellent location near Termini station, the Metro and the bus station. This does not imply ,however, that there is a lot of traffic noise - the hotel is situated in a side street off the Via Nazionale.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: w62
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying at the Mondial after seeing some of the reviews. But fear not it is a traditional European 4 star hotel. Ok so maybe not the most modern rooms but what else would you expect in a city where you are surrounded by buildings that date several hundred years BC! The room we had was spacious and clean (immaculately clean I have to say). We requested a quiet room and so it was at the back of the hotel so a little dark but very peaceful and we slept like logs. Bed was very comfy and yes we had only 3 pillows so guess what? We asked reception and they gave us another. Staff were friendly, breakfast was good - some hot choices as well as the standard continental options. Location was excellent - wewalked everywhere, absolutely no need to use public transport and great for getting from airport to Termini - which is near hotel. We walked down Via Cavour every morning to the ancient city. Fab! Termini area is criticised in guide books but that's just because it's a bog standard part of the city as opposed to the picturesque bits. But it was fine - some good pizzerias nearby. The original Est Est Est is on Via Genova, just round the corner from the hotel -it was recommended in our guide book. Cheap and cheerful - we went twice! Anti-pasto, pizza and pasta each and a carafe of red wine - 25 euros! We had a fantastic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Saved by Hotel Mondial”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review already but clicked enter by mistake, and lost my review. Bummer. I'll try again. I'll be brief as it's too frustrating to lose the review I was working on. We were able to get three rooms by just walking in off the street. We were so relieved as we had booked at the Sonya Suites and ended up in a dump down the street from that hotel. Deceived by Sonya Suites. The rooms were very shabby but such a step up from the other hotel we almost had to stay in. The beds were hard, as usual. We are convinced that you would have to spend 500 Euros to get a comfortable bed. We were swayed by the Best Western affiliation, but realized that it doesn't mean anything. The quality is not consistent with what we are used to in North America. Still so much better than where we might have had to stay. The irony is that this hotel was less pricey (125 Euros) than the other hotel. Go figure! The breakfast was not great so we ate elsewhere the last two days of our stay at the hotel. If you bring your laptop, the wireless won't work if you use Vista. You will have to reconfigure your internet options and that will lead to a whole heap of trouble for the rest of your holiday. My son and I did this, reconfigure our computers, with the help of the front desk, and we ended up unable to use our internet for the duration of our holiday. It actually took me a good month after my return to Canada to figure out how to get my computer to access the internet. What a hassle. The rooms are very tired and the AC is not up to standard. The walls are paper thin so we had to endure our neighbours having sex. Thank God they were not on their honeymoon. This would not be a great place for a honeymoon anyway. The location is excellent. Just minutes away from the Train and bus terminals and taxis are always going by. The street has a great international marketplace and the restaurant next door is really good. We bought tickets for the ON/OFF bus and were able to travel the city and stop at any of the sites that interested us. In hindsight, we would not buy tickets for these tour buses as the taxis are very reasonable. I had a wonderful experience in Rome, I suffer from Phlebitis and I had a bad flare up and was worried that I wouldn't be able to partake in our adventures in Rome. I did manage to walk to a restaurant the first evening and we went to a pharmacy (look for the green cross), and I told the pharmacist my dilemma. He gave me a packet of pills, that I would have needed a prescription for in Canada, and after one dose, I was ready to walk for miles. I could not believe my good fortune for getting these pills that helped get rid of my phlebitis.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4-star standard”
Reviews.Author: khabster
Reviews.Content: The Good: The location was decent. It wasn't near any of the major sites but it's close to the train station that gets you to those sites. The front desk staff was very helpful and nice. Breakfast was good, and the lobby was charming. The Bad, and The Ugly: The rooms were definitely not 4-star quality. The beds were small and uncomfortable. The decor was very old-fashioned. The bathroom was actually bigger than the bedroom. We paid a reasonable amount, but that didn't make up for the fact that this was not on par with other 4-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Shoddy,Shabby,Surley”
Reviews.Author: cal_guthrie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly, I'm still in this hotel for one more night. The level of service is truly appalling here. While some of the staff are very helpful and quite nice, the majority are really arrogant, rude and generally snide to the extreme. On arrival I requested a smoking room for myself and my mother and cousin( their first trip to Rome) told It would be the next morning befor 2 somking rooms were vacant. Thats ok, I'm happy with that. BUT to find the double was still in the process of being painted at 10 am, well not really impressed and when i asked if there was a finished room for them the gentleman(and i use the term very losely ,informed me take it or leave it) we left it. My room,Rembering this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel are just big enough to hold a single bed, the internet cable only reaches to the bed so a bit akward typing here. The kicker was last night though. I went into the bathroom, The bathroom door knob fell off.nd LOL, big deal says I. But i was unable to put it back on to open the door. Ok, well there is an emergency cord over the shower. I'll pull it for assistance. Minor problem or 2 here. 1. after a light pull it came out of the wall COMPLEATLY 2. While it did set the assistance required light out side my door, it didn't allert the staff at the front desk.I'm now told it was just ignored, charming behavior. So locked in a bathroom , wow what a great way to see Rome. Fortunatly my mother came to find out why i was so late when we were going out. On seeing the emergency light she went to the reception desk to ask for help. There she was informed there was no spare key and she would need to find the bell boy. 80 years old and a cancer sufferer, she was very upset. I might mention I'm epleptic. So yes she was in a panic.Finally bellboy found he opened the door and just walked off. A bit upset i went to the reception desk. Brandishing the offending door knob. Requesting the door be fixed and the alarm as well. After recounting my story, some barley surpressed grins, Well it is kind of funny.NOW. As i left the reception area, Howles of mirth. Unfortunatly fot the night staff i understand the word IDIOT yes even in Italian. NO I'm not impressed. It is now 2am the next day Still waiting for repairs Still waiting for my shoe box to be made up Still waiting for any word from the Manager. Beware. Not a fun place to be Best Wester, NO A bunch of cowboys YES NEVER EVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: “Best Western came to our rescue”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieWirral
Reviews.Content: We ended up this hotel after having booked at 3* close by, via Expedia, which was closed on arrival - so this was their alternative with no extra cost to us, due to inconvenience. Good location agree with others re distance from Termini. Close to metro for general getting around. Arrived on 19th September in pouring rain which didn't stop all day. We had read about pre booking for Vatican but decided against it. We had read that many of the pre bookings and guided tours commence in morning, that it was therefore better to go in afternoon and avoid Saturdays. With this in mind once we had hotel - we jumped metro and duly arrived at Vatican mid afternoon in pouring rain. Queued for about 30 mins, and have feeling it would have been less but for the rain. which encouraged others. Fantastic. 14 euros. We flew round it due to time constraints and fitted in St Peters afterwards. Also went (via metro) to Trevi Fountain in evening - lovely when lit up and not so crowded. Next day glorious. Breakfast brilliant at hotel and starts at 6.45, great for the early birds, and especially if you are on early morning flight back. Walked to Colosseum. again, didn't prebook (9 euros) but were there by 9.00 am and queued for 10 mins (would have crossed over to Palatine if going to be longer). Joint ticket with forum and Palatine Hill. we came out of colosseum after a couple of hours (hard to describe it adequately) and queue was terrific. Over the road at Palatine folks could have bought same ticket with much shorter queue. Buy bottles of water or something before going into Palatine/forum, it's a lot of walking, you don't want to rush and nowhere to get liquid refreshments inside. Pantheon impressive, Piazza Navone good fun - watch the painters and the entertainers. Ice cream essential wherever. Okay to eat cost wise- it's the drinks the issue. Could get into colosseum, Forum and Palatine hill combined for same price as a large beer. Seems flawed somehow. No coffee making in hotel on display but if you phone up (as detailed in the info book) they provide free of charge kettle, and all the coffee, tea you need. Safe in room free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “We were completly satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Ranetka
Reviews.Content: The hotel absolutly meets the rating of 4 stars. Rooms are very big, cleen and comfortable, with high ceilings. Breakfast is excellent in comparison with the common breakfast in the Central Europe, it is like the reach breakfast in Scandinavian countries. The location of the hotel is also very good (7 min from the railway station Termini). There was some noise from the next room, but that was not very disturbing. The staff was attentive and polite. So we were very pleasured with our vacation there. (There may be some problems for russians and tourists from other non-Shengen countries when making visa, because the hotel refuses to send the official confirmation of reservation).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: BateyBoy
Reviews.Content: Location is great if travelling to/from the Termini train station - 10 minute walk, even if wheeling cases. We walked to all the sights, although the Vatican was quite a trek. The room was nice and quiet and spacious, but could do with some updating. Breakfast was good - a good choice of cereal, fruit, etc. There was air conditioning in the room, but it wasn't very efficient. It was very hot during our stay and we found the room a bit warm at night. Staff were a mixed bunch - some very pleasant and helpful, others not so. We asked one to phone a particular restaurant to book a table for us as we don't speak Italian. He told us that he had done it and that there were no tables available. We walked past it later and got a table easily. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cleator
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Metro station close by and really easy to use. Buy your tickets at the newsagent stand opposite or in the station. Great way to get to St Peter's and the Vatican. All other sites are within walking distance. The railway station and bus station are very close by. We returned to the airport by shuttle bus (Ciampino) - which goes from the railway station. We easily walked to the railway station with all of our luggage on wheels (less than 10 minutes) and the fare was only 6 euro per person. One word of warning. Make sure you know where the bus goes from. There are no signs anywhere. It is actually on Via Marsala at the end of the station closest to the hotel. Check for via Marsala on the map. I think you can also catch the train to Fiumcino airport too from the station but check.. We did have a similar problem when checking in to the hotel to the people from Utah - see their earlier review. I had a stand up row with an objectionable bloke on the desk. There had been a mix up with the booking which they blamed on Best Western. To be fair, we were not 100% blameless but the attitude of the guy was not good. He would probably say the same about me. Anyway, check your booking - room types and number of guests or you may end up like the Utah people. Fortunately, there was also a lady on the desk who together with my wife sorted the problem while I ranted wth the guy, To cut a long story short they solved the problem and were very good about it all in the end. The lady on reception was excellent. Furthermore, her female colleague the next day was superb and gave us great advice about transport etc. She was a star too! The rooms were not brilliant but it was what I expected of a major city centre hotel. Breakfast was okay too. Couple of tips - we stood in the queue for the Colloseum for ages. I think it is possible to buy tickets in advance so look in to that if you can. Also, take the audio guide - it is superb and good value. If you are an EU citizen you also get a discount but need to have some ID. Your EU medical cards are a good idea - saves you carrying passports etc. Also take the audioguide for the Vatican museum and St Peter''s basillica tour. It is excellent too. For the Vatican and the Colliseum you will be offered a personal guide for an extra 20 or so Euros which is tempting if it is hot and there are long queues. However, the wait is never as long as they say and the audioguides are a good way to do it anyway. I'm sure the guided tours are good too if you want to spend the extra cash. If you arrive at Ciampino and need to pick up a hire car you have to wait for a shuttle bus to take you to the pick up offices. It doesn't seem to run very often. After a long flight it is not a good idea to wait around if it is really hot and if the queue is long you may not get on the bus. My tip is walk it!! The offices are within easy walking distance just down the road and to the left. ask for directions or llok it up on the map. Advantage here is you get to the front of the queue too as all the tourists come bashing in after you. Watch out for expensive restaurants close to the hotel. We had a couple of icecreams and beers (4 of us) and it came to 60 euros. Great city Roma though. Have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: katrinallika
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mondial with my teenage son last week of July. Location is just wonderful, close to all sites, we didn't use public transportation (besides taxi) and walked to all major places of interest. Hotel was very clean, room spacious, bathroom nice and clean, air conditioning working, breakfast wonderful (coffee could have been stronger). Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Next door is excellent restaurant Cotto with very good service, delicious food and nice Italian waiters. We would definitely stay at Mondial next time in Rome. Keep up the good work! Katrin from Estonia

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good there at the Mondial!!”
Reviews.Author: ozzyoslo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2008, and was pleasantly surprise !! From the main Train station its a 15 minute walk with carrying luggage with wheels fastened to the base. Foyer is natually inviting once you walk in staff are very professional and make you welcome. The room is quite basic but when you are in rome you are there to see the sites not stay in the room!! When saying basic I mean there is a safe you can use (FREE) and decor is to an acceptable standard. Tv is the old style that has internet and video on request ( pay per view) Bathroom was of a very good standard and pleasant to experience. Breakfast in the morning was excellent and staff there were great and always there to help when needed. There is so much to see in rome that where to stay is not really an important issue, we walked everywhere and in the end when after being "walked out "over the course of the week (sorrento included)catching a bus was not a problem. I have no hessitation what so ever to recommend this hotel and hope I have helped people feel safe in the knowledge that this is a decent, clean, cheap hotel stay not forgetting providing a very good breakfast before one starts the days tour. Rome is truely a great city and there is so much to see off the beaten track we just walked out with no set agenda and had a ball.......... stay away from the tourist area restaurants and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: marchbird
Reviews.Content: good location, room service needed a lot to be desired 45 minutes is too long to wait; tea and coffee facilities were available when requested but one milk, tea bag, sugar each time was rather tight, and polystiring cups just didnt help, better off taking your own. overall clean and tidy and reception and porters really helpful, but the room service did let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, too bad about the AC”
Reviews.Author: Rickebob
Reviews.Content: 6 friends stayed at the BW Mondial June 13-16. As most reviewers have mentioned, the proximity to the train station as well as subway is perfect. Rome is huge and being able to walk 5 minutes to the metro is nice, as is the 10 minute walk to the termini when you are ready to depart. There are also abundant restaurants within easy walking distance, some more expensive than others. Learn to eat standing up and you can escape with some euro's left. Check in/Check out was handled quickly and efficiently. I didn't care for the desk keeping my passport for several hours but when in Rome... Staff were all friendly and put up with my pitiful attempts at Italian with smiles. Continental breakfast is on par with Best Westerns around the world. What does one expect for "free". Mostly bread, meats, cereals, cheese etc. They tried scrambled eggs. For the love of Pete, skip them. Rooms were typical for Europe (or so I am told). Small but clean. Dated but comfortable. The bathroom in 402 was adequate with a full tub and reasonable shower. My problem with this hotel is, that for about $300 per night, there was no air conditioning at all. No amount of complaint to the desk or manager had any effect, just a "sorry, we are working on it". Perhaps this would not be such a problem at a $40/night Days Inn somewhere but at these prices one should be able to expect a comfortable room. As it was, we had to sleep each night with the window open so as to not suffocate. Rome is not a quiet city and we found it impossible to get a nights rest what with constant traffic noise, the most obnoxious birds (gulls I think) and to our delight, an impromptu fireworks display at about 4AM one morning. MAMA MIA! if not for the broken AC I would give this hotel a much better review but such a glaring problem is hard to overlook, no matter how great Rome was. I feel certain there are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: acegt1
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel for the money, we booked via BestWestern.com and paid for a non-refundable Internet rate. Otherwise it may have been a bit overpriced for us. Rooms are dated but appeared to be clean. Location is good - 10 minute walk from Termini station which is convenient if you're coming in by train, want to leave by train, or want to drop off a rental car (many rental cars are dropped off at a garage across from Termini station). Also close to the Republica d'Opera Metro station, just a few minutes walk, if you want to hop on the train to go somewhere such as the Vatican City. Front desk staff was not terribly friendly although we were spoiled elsewhere in Italy. First room we had was on the first floor right next to a building under construction so we were awakened by construction noise at 6:30AM the first morning. We asked to be moved and they moved us to the 4th floor and a few rooms over. Still heard noise but not as bad. Turning on the hot water in BOTH rooms was noisy and I'm sure our neighbors didn't appreciate it - the pipes hummed which wasn't that big of a deal for a 5-minute shower but tells you how old the hotel is. Bathroom smelled of cigarette smoke even though it was a non-smoking room - I feel confident that the smoke was coming in from an adjacent room. I'd recommend it only because you're not going to spend much time there while in Rome - just to sleep. The place is pretty good but not a 4-star experience as it has been rated.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Bubakar
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. Location is very good as the metro is close by as is the termini train station (has airport shuttles). There is a great market/cafe next to the hotel where you can sit outside. The food is very good and cheap as well. The room was on the smaller side but clean. The bathroom was also clean. Very basic amenities and the TV was small. The mini-bar was old as well. Comfortable bed and not a lot of noise at night. The breakfast was very basic and limited. Quality was good but I have had better and it did not fill you up for a long day of walking and sight-seeing. The staff was average at best. Seemed a bit disinterested overall. Made a bad recommendation for dinner out first night there (bread basket cost 6 Euros and we barely touched it).

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Accommodations in a Convenient, Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: euorpaphile
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mondial is convenient to the Termini rail station in Rome, which is a 20 - 25 minute train ride from Rome's Funicello FCO Airport. From the Termini, it is a three block walk. Facing the Opera, the hotel is to the right, halfway down the block. From the Hotel Mondial, we were able to easily walk to the Forum, the Collesium, Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. CHECK-IN - We prepaid for our room, but, unfortunately were a day late due to airline troubles. We called the booking agent to notify the hotel that we would not be there the first night. Upon, arrival, we were initially told that we had arrived too early to check-in. After explaining the situation, we were given a room. The front desk staff, while cordial, made us feel defensive for asking for what we had already paid. ROOM: Adequate. Two twin beds, side-by-side, as they frequently are in Europe. The bathroom was large for European standards. The beds were comfortable, but we had been up for 40 hours when we finally laid down. BREAKFAST: Lovely. The food, the selection, the coffee and the service were all above board. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: pmlew
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days in Rome celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary. Got a fairly good deal despite it being Easter weekend. The room was nice and spacious, most of the staff where friendly and helpful, the only gripe was that the hotel bar was a bit of a rip off (20 euro's for a Baileys and a JD & coke!) The location is very good, being close to the metro and the central station. The Trevi fountain and Colosseum are both only a 15/20 minute walk away. I don't know if we made bad choice's but we never found what we considered to be a decent Italian restaurant in Rome (despite also getting recommendations from the Hotel reception) - We did however find a nice little Indian called "il guru" about 10 mins walk from the hotel. We would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel for tired tourists”
Reviews.Author: penarthguy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mondial was the recommended 4 star hotel of Air Miles and we stayed there over Easter 2008. It is just 5 minutes from the main rail station Termini and is well placed as a jumping off place to see all the sites - the famous 64 bus (watch out for pick pockets) stops very nearby. The staff were welcoming from the moment we arrived and our double room was big and airy; but the whole place frankly could do with a lick of paint. It has a very well worn look about it and the lifts are pretty much clapped out. One was broken for some of our stay and the second would only take 3 people not the 5 as indicated. The public rooms are rather faded grandeur but no one seems to use them. In the bedroom the do-it-yourself tea tray was sent up only if requested and had a rather dolls house look about it. With plastic cups and rather horrid plastic stirrers it was really rather shoddy. If things were used they were not replaced. This "cheap as chips" approach was mirrored in the bathroom where the "glasses" were tacky bouncy plastic. On the plus side the breakfast buffet worked well with strong coffee and a good range of cold meats, cheese, jams and rolls as well as the more standard scrambled eggs and funny looking bacon. All in all the Mondial is a good base for a few days; but dont think the equivalent of a UK 4 star hotel. In fact as there are about three thousand hotels in Rome it seemed surprising that Air Miles recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SCM03E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our graduation trip when we finished college. We didn't want to spend too much money, and we got a great deal on this hotel. This was by far the nicest place for the money! The location is wonderful (right near a metro and the central station), and also near the Piazza della Republique which has really nice cafes and little restaurants. Our room was huge, with a very nice bathroom and full sized shower (which if you haven't been to Europe is quite rare!). The breakfast was good, and there was a fantastic cafe open late called the Gran Cafe Strega around the corner, great place to end the night with a bottle of wine! It was quiet, convenient, and the staff was great! Rome can be very loud at night, so I was surprised by how quiet it was there. I would recommend this place to anyone travelling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: Marcelinha
Reviews.Content: Find a hotel in Rome by that time was very difficult, almost none was available and the ones left were so expensive. We decided for BW Mondial because Best Western is a well know brand for hotels. The localization ot the hotel is great, one block from the subway station ans three from the central Termini Station, what is really great, lots of nice restaurants and stuff near the hotel. The hotel room was a little old and needs an urgent restoration, but it has a good space, was clean and had a good ans spacious bathroom. The breakfast was very good, with lots of options and very good food. But the problem of this hotel is really the staff. I had read a bad review about them in the booking.com, but I didnt care and now I know I should have. Saying they are rude wouldn´t be enough. We stayed there for four days, paying an expensive fare and we were treated as if we were in a public lodging. Everything we asked was treated like if they were doing us a favour, since calling a cab to recomend us a restaurant in Trastevere. Bad service would be too little to say about it! In exception of an employee called Fawsil and another guy who was working earlier in the same night and helped us with the key we forgot in the room (he was working at 9 p.m. at sat, 6 oct. I dont remember his name, bus he´s tall, thin and has dark and little curvy hair. very nice with everyone), that were very kind to us, the others were very very rude, treating us bad and having no patience and understanding with the guests. I was never treated like that in a hotel, no even in youth hostels I stayed in many countries. So, since BW is a weel know brand and this is a 4 star hotel, I really wasn´t expecting this 'doggy' treatment to guests. So, even though the other things of the hotel are good (room, breakfast, location), all of these qualities are absolutelly anulled by the bad attendance. I wouldnt recomend it for nobody and wouldn´t ever return as well, to this and any ohter Best Western Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: dacocs0103
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Hotel Mondial is a good hotel for the price. Bathroom is big, w/tub and clean. Room is big enough for 3 o 4 people with two twin beds together and a sofabed. Breakfast is of good quality and good variety. Front desk staff needs to be more receptive of foreigners needs with willingness to assist them. Some staff members are not as friendly and unwilling to help at first. Management on the other hand, is great and very receptive of guest needs and goes beyond to make you welcome. Hotel Mondial is centrally located and within walking distance from Rome Termini (10 min.) Autobus and many shops/restaurants/Mcdonalds, pizzas are within a block away. 15-20 mins walk to Colissium, Trevi Fountain , Pantheon and many other attractions. Dont need a car in Rome, parking is expensive and non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: ian_buell
Reviews.Content: I have never been treated so horribly at any hotel in any country I have ever been in. The travel agent made a mistake and instead of booking two rooms for myself and my brother in law, she booked a double room (two beds) for 3 people (me, wife, sister-in-law). When we got there and found this out, they insisted we pay for another room even though there were two beds and could easily sleep two couples. Where was my brother-in-law to sleep? They would not help us find another solution, such as paying a little extra for one more person. We are young couples and had budgeted the entire trip around what the travel agent told us it would cost. We could not afford another $230 or so per night for the 4 days we were to spend there. The argument became heated with the management yelling at me, and me yelling back. We came in on a bus late that night, getting there at around 10:30 p.m. It was too late to get another hotel - they were all locked up for the night by the time the argument ended. They would not relent, so my brother in law and myself ended up sleeping at the train station that night. They would not allow more than two people to go up to the room, and were not even going to allow us to put both our (couple's) luggage in the room - only the couple who was staying the night. I just said it was all mine then. I had to haul it all up myself to the room - my brother in law was not allowed to go up. When I and my brother-in-law left they locked the door, and would not even allow my wife and sister to bring down something for us for a pillow (would not unlock doors). In the morning I came back to get showered and help get the luggage down after sleeping on the ground - we were not going to continue staying there. My brother in law waited in the lobby. He overheard them saying something between themselves about calling the police. He used the house phone and called up to the room and I ran down and out to avoid being arrested. My wife later said the bellman did not help her or my sister in law with the luggage on the way out. We found a hotel that morning that while not quite as fancy, was extremely helpful and kind to us. They even let us leave our luggage there after we had checked out while we went sightseeing and waited for transit. To end this, I would not stay there. It is overpriced and the service is abhorrent. It should have been wonderful - it is a Best Western! That symbol is supposed to stand for a level of quality and service! To this day, and forever, I will not stay in a Best Western hotel, no matter where it is at. If they can brand a hotel like that with their symbol, that hotel and that chain cannot have my business and I hope they will not get yours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: beehappygolucky
Reviews.Content: We have just returned frome our amazing trip to Rome ! We booked with Easy Jet and had a great deal staying in the Mondial ! The Hotel was great with a very impressive reception area,all staff are very friendly and more than happy to help with directions ! The room was a little small and wasnt as grand as the reception but we only slept there.I must say the room was spotless,we only stayed two nights but we still had maid service ! There is a great resteraunt called 'Target' down the street,the hotel recomended it,food was great and full of locals so must be good !!! The location is fantastic we walked to The Colessseum,Trevi Fountain,Pantheon and spanish steps. When visiting Rome Make sure you go to St Peters,Vatican Square its breathtaking !!! Overall excellent stay in Rome and will visit The Mondial again. Another point is that there is a fixed price for taxis from Ciampino airport to rome center (inc Mondial) of 30euros,we got ripped off when we arrived and paid 55euros,this is a law that came into effect in 2006 !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look for Another Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: pmow
Reviews.Content: Yes the Mondial is a close walk to the train station and yes, the hotel staff will "seem" to be helpful. Here is what happened when we checked in -- the clerk offered to set up a taxi ride to the airport for us the next morning. I had seen the flyer stating that the rate is a fixed 40 euros provided by the official white taxis. I assumed this was what the clerk proposed; we stated we would think about it and let him know. Within 30 minutes, we went down to the desk and said yes, we would take the taxi. The clerk said it would be their private car service and that the rate would be 50 euros -- that was the only transportation they could "guarantee". If they called a regular taxi for us, they could not guarantee. Of course we had discussions about the 40 versus 50 price, etc. Long story short, we took the train to the airport, no problem. It was bothersome to have this type of proposal and approach from what bills itself as a four star hotel (that is questionable). Watch yourself with the taxis and the car services!! Yes, the room was a good size and very quiet. However, when I attempted to use the hair dryer (tv on also, lights in the room etc.) Lo and behold, all went dark. We made our way out to the hall and down to the desk...an employee fixed the blown circuit and told me "no hairdryer". So...not to use the hairdryer is one thing but that made me nervous about the state of the electrical systems in the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mondial - Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Via Torino by the side of the Opera, a couple of minutes from Via Nazionale, 5 minutes from Stazione Termini and Santa Maira Maggiore. Location very central. Nearest Metro Piazza Republica (2 minutes). Bus, from Via Nazionale. You will not need to use Taxis. All major tourist sites in the City, easily accessible from the Hotel. Good Buffet Breakfast (American). No restaurant but plenty available close by. Staff were quite helpful if you asked for help. In Italy, people rarely volunteer help! Some tips about the City: St. Peters - be prepared for 45 minutes in a queue to clear Security. Vatican Museum - You may need to spend 90 minutes in a queue to get into the Museum, during the season. Recommend Audiioguide. The Colloseum - 30 minutes in a queue to get in. Recommend Audioguide; very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: yorom
Reviews.Content: I booked the cheapest 4* hotel I could possibly find..... all the prices were around €200-300 but I found this hotel for $200usd on Orbitz. We were given room #101 and I highly recommend it. It was HUGE and impeccable. The breakfast was fine to me... the lounge was very comfortable and the staff was flawless. I will be back. If you are Rome-bound I highly recommend the months of October, April and May. The other months are either quite cold and wet and uncomfortable or extremely hot, humid and touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lostincolumbus
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on hotels.com after checking out the reviews here. I was little concerned about some of the bad reviews but it sounded like a good deal for the price. We were very satisfied by the hotel once we got there. It is in a nice location, right near the Termini station and thus easily accessed from the airports and very close to a Metro station as well. The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke English, which was a relief. Even when we locked ourselves out of our room AND locked ourselves out of the in-room safe, the hotel staff was wonderfully helpful and friendly. The room was a little small from my (American) perspective but my (British) girlfriend says it is roomy by European standards. The breakfast was not fantastic but they had cereal, rolls, pastry, hot drinks and juice so it is definitely decent. We had a great experience and would definitely go back. The amenities are more than adequate and the hotel staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base of Operation”
Reviews.Author: Malaga97
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be a good base for our four nights in Rome. It is very close to the main terminal and only a few minutes walk from the Repubblica stop, but we walked everywhere to balance out our indulgent meals! About 20 minutes to the Trevi, 30 to Piazza Navona and the Colosseum. The room's decor and the bathroom were definitely modest, but more importantly, they were very clean and the A/C worked well during the upper 90-degree days we were there. It was a little annoying that the shower would create huge puddles on the floor, but we had enough towels that we just threw one or two down with the bathmat. Front desk wasn't overly friendly, but that seems to be par for the course with the Italian service sector, and they certainly were not rude. The included breakfast was nice enough; wait staff immediately asked if we'd like coffee or tea upon our entrance, and we appreciated being able to have some healthy buffet choices--like yogurt, fruit, and granola--for at least one meal per day! One thing--we asked the front desk about getting us a cab to the airport for an early flight (hence we did not want to mess with the train). They (only) told us about the shuttle service affiliated with the hotel, which was a flat rate of 50 euros. I just read another review here in which someone took a Mercedes for 45 (!) and apparently that was only "slightly more" than a cab. So it looks like we probably paid way too much! Lesson learned to do a little more research for airport transportation. Location Info: The few blocks surrounding the hotel are not glamourous, but we certainly felt safe enough walking back at night along Via Nazionale. The hotel is less than a block from the Via Torino intersection, and there is a decent, very reasonably priced restaurant there with standard Italian comfort food. On Via Torino, there are several nice small shops (a Murano glass shop, Italian food specialities, antiques, etc.) and a few nice restaurants along the way. We did not eat at Gigli (others have raved about it) because my husband was wearing shorts; this was irritating since seemingly nicer restaurants did not have a problem with it, especially considering it was so hot even at night! Instead, for a charming setting and an out of this world dinner experience, make a reservation at Latorraca Rosa on Via Farini, a 5 minute walk away.
