We had a seven course tasting menu for 100 euros that was so delicious, and, as we were one of only two filled tables, we were treated like honored guests! The hotel proved a great location for touring churches; we walked about 30 minutes along Via Merulana to San Giovanni in Laterano, and then worked our way back to the hotel, stopping at San Clemente and Santa Maria Maggiore. There are several other lovely churches (e.g. San Carlo alle Quattro Fontane and Sant'Andrea al Quirinale) within a 15 minute walk as well. All in all, a pretty good deal; we did an "early web special" that got us a king bed for about $130 a night. For that price in Rome in July, it was definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite place in Rome St Peters Square”
Reviews.Author: beckyRome
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a city break in Rome. We thought the Mondial Hotel very good value.Very clean and the buffet breakfast was fine except for the tea and coffee. Very central we walked to most of the attractions.The city tour is a really good way to get started.We used Green Line tours but the 110 bus seems the most popular and slightly cheaper.We loved Ristorante del Giglio good atmosphere and lovely food and only about four buildings from Hotel Mondial. Rita and Lloyd.

Reviews.Title: “We would happily stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Prop
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Mondial. It is much better than previous reviews may lead people to believe. The problem may be the 4 star rating raises expectations that it is likely to be of a standard similar to an international chain like the Hilton or the Marriott. The Monidal is in a good location. It is directly opposite the Opera Theatre and just off Via Nazionale, one of the main shopping streets. It is round the corner from Piazza Republica which has a Metro station. The Trevi Fountain is about a 15 minute walk. Termini is about 10 minutes in the other direction, but the hotel is far enough away not to attract some of the undesirables seen nearer the station. Our room was very spacious for a city centre hotel, with a full sized bath. The room was clean, but the decoration is a bit spartan. We thought the breakfast was ok for a city centre hotel, with a reasonable choice of hot and cold items. The staff when we checked in were very friendly and helpful. I must admit that when we checked out, the receptionist had a manner probably described as briskly efficient. He was very impatient with some other guests, but in fairness I had every sympathy with him given the inane questions they were asking. The staff reflect the Roman character of the hotel. If you want staff with a permanent smile who are programmed to wish you a nice day, you are probably better off at a Marriott or Hilton. If you want some real character, the Mondial is just fine. The Ristorant Giglo 2 doors down is a very good restaurant but it is at the pricier and posher end of the scale. We paid 100 euros for a 2 course meal with a bottle of house red, which we thought was reasonable value for money. There are also a couple of little bars/cafes either side of the hotel with a few pavement tables. We spent some time sipping morning cappuccinos and one late evening with a bottle of Vino Rosso watching the world go by and playing "guess the nationality". Italians were easy to spot as they are so incredibly, and effortlessly, stylish. We used Stefano's car service for the journey from the Airport based on TA recommendations, to which we can now add. 45 euros one way is only a bit dearer than a standard taxi and worth paying for the luxury of a new Mercedes. We would recommend you use a tour guide service to get the best out of the sights. We used Via Tours for the Colosseum and Palantine and Romatours for the Vatican. Both tours were over 3 hours long, very interesting but did involve a fair amount of walking. Two final recommendations - do not try to drive yourself in Rome! The driving is absolutely manic. On both our journey from and to the airport we saw scooter riders who had been knocked off their bikes and we spoke to other travellers who seen similar collisions. Finally beware a friendly little chap at the Spanish Steps who will engage you in conversation and then starts twisting a friendship bracelet around your little finger. It could be the most expensive piece of coloured string you will ever buy. We though we were quite street savvy, but we got caught this time. It is apparently a well known Rome scam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Emmsiecat
Reviews.Content: Don't believe all the negative reviews about this hotel as we've recently stayed there and found it to be excellent. The location is the star attraction with the main Termini station being less than a five minute walk away. The hotel is tucked down a quiet street but all the hustle and bustle of Rome is just round the corner with plenty of reasonably priced bars, shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. Our room was fairly large with a big bathroom complete with enormous sink and powerful shower. Unfortunately there was absolutely no view from the window but the little amount of time we actually spent in it in daylight hours, it didn't matter. The breakfast is good with a large choice of hot and cold food which is served right up until 10.30am for the late risers. The staff were friendly and we found the hotel to be very clean with fresh linen everyday. We recommend you try the restaurant a few doors along called Giglio as it's exceptional and there's a pizzeria on Via Genova called Est! Est! Est! which is reputed to be the oldest one in Rome and served the most amazing Insalata Caprese!

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: rach100
Reviews.Content: We had an awful experience in this hotel. We were shown into an incredibly noisy room initially, then one which stank of cigarettes, before accepting a small one on the top floor because it was quiet. All were extremely dated and not paticularly clean. We would have left but didn't want to waste a day hotel trawling. Later we discovered the bath had hairs in it and the drainer was missing, displaying mouldy metal. We complained about the hairs and someone came to the room whilst we were out but didn't get rid of them! Breakfast poor. We paid a lot for the room and were appalled at how bad this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “danger of getting electrocuted...”
Reviews.Author: lolaborro
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome. The rooms are shabby, decorated with old tired furniture soiled carpets and stained walls but the most worrying thing of all is that the sockets come of the wall... quite scary, I didn't use my laptop or hairdrier during my whole stay for fear of getting electrocuted. The area is quite bad as well, convenient to get to the Termini station, yes but... the area is really rough! You can't walk around safely, the area is plagued with beggars and strage types, definitely not safe. The breakfast is quite bad, pastry is dry, and the selection quite poor. Their staff is a misture of friendly and patronising people. And also be careful withe their cancellations policy, most hotels let you cancel before 4pm on the day of arrival, in here it is a 24 hrs notice, I didn't realise, had to postpone my trip by one day and they made me pay for one extra night!!

Reviews.Title: “Place to return to”
Reviews.Author: bofoster
Reviews.Content: Booked this one because the other choices were taken. Yet it turned out to be our best choice so far. Walkable distance from Termini. Not a group tour destination. The entrance was inconvenienced by road work. Lack of restaurant in house is compensated by a good restaurant only a few doors away. Breakfast included eggs and fruit etc. Good size room as well as bathroom. Like other downtown hotels, window didn't offer a nice view. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Mondial”
Reviews.Author: haveticketwilltravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times, twice this past summer. Staff is helpful. Once they mapped out a walking tour for us. They allowed me to freshen up in their restroom and kept my backpack in storage when I arrived very early in the day and the room was not yet ready (understandably). They called my room as soon as the airline brought my lost luggage and brought it up immediately. They arranged a car to take us to the airport very early in the morning when we had to fly back to the US. They made us next day reservations at the Borghese Gallery. They arranged for us to take a tour to Pompeii. They were always willing to answer questions and make arrangements. -- There is a computer in the lobby with free internet access.-- Breakfast buffet was always good and plentiful. There is a pleasant breakfast room. Staff was friendly. -- It is walkable from the train station, so if you have little luggage and take the Leonardo Express from the airport and have a good map of Rome, you could walk, as I did when the airline lost my luggage. A cab from the Termini Station is 10 euros. -- It is just around the corner from the Excedra Hotel (located at Piazza del Republica) which is very expensive. Try the Target Restaurant just down the street from the Mondial on Torini . -- I walked everywhere in Rome, often coming back to the hotel along Nazionale, where there were always other people walking. -- There is a little store (like a 7-11) between Nazionale and the hotel where you can get a bottle of water for 55 cents. There is also a little clothing store next to the hotel and a jewelry store on the same street which have some cute things.

Reviews.Title: “don't go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetoff
Reviews.Content: my husband and i have just returned from this hotel on 10 august 2006, we went for our 30th wedding anniversary. to say the staff are rude is an understatement. i have never met such ignorant hotel staff & i have been all over the world. our luggage didnt make our connecting flight & didn't arrive until the next day. i asked their reception if they would ring my mobile phone to let us know when our luggage arrived & they refused point blank saying it would be too expensive. we had to walk around for 2 days with the same clothes we had travelled in as it was sunday & we couldn't find a shop open to buy any new clothing. this is not a 4 star hotel by any means. the rooms are shabby & definitely need a lick of paint. the shutters on the outside of our room wouldn't open so it was like a prison. the breakfast was made up of hard bread & rolls& greasy bacon cold hard boiled eggs & various other non appetising food. whatever you asked of the staff at this hotel it seemed to be too much. i would def give this hotel a miss & shop around for a better one

Reviews.Title: “BW Mondial - OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: pucca_girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently visited Rome and stayed at the Best Western Mondial (July 16-22). Like the previous review mentions, it's in a good location. We took the Express from Leonardo da Vinci airport (roughly 1/2 hour) then walked to the hotel which took about 10-15minutes. Located just off Via Nazionale, it's surrounded by restaurants and there's a SPAR supermarket nearby. Check-in isn't until 3pm but the hotel staff are happy to stow away your luggage until you check-in. Reception was polite, not exactly chirpy! Our room was quite big and I had earlier requested a quieter room which is what we got. The room and bathroom were all very clean which is very good by my standards! The decor is a bit dated, and we didn't have a view but that was fine with us. Breakfast at the hotel is very good - there's a wide selection to suit all. Also, there is access to the internet in the reception area. We managed to visit all the tourist attractions on our 'hit list' in good time. Plus have time to eat lots of yummi gelato! And we took pictures of all the Illuminati markers as read in Dan Brown's Angels & Demons! Helpful hints: if you buy a telephone card to call home, free phone numbers are at no extra cost if you use the hotel phone (comfier than using the public payphones!). If you plan to visit the Colosseum, the best time to go is first thing in the morning - hardly any queues. The guided tour is quite informative and cheap at only EUR 3.50. 110 Bus tour from Termini is very good - at EUR 13.00 it goes to all the 'major' tourist attractions. If you want good views of Rome, you should climb up St. Peter's dome - a bit claustrophobic when you climb up and down but the views are excellent! NB. women need to cover their shoulders and knees when visiting St.Peter's basilica and most churches - we saw many people turned away for not being covered up! All in all, a good trip although July is veryvery hot! I would recommend this hotel if you need a place to crash after a long day's exploring. Siestas are good too when the sun is at it's hottest!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice, especially for active visitors...”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVATraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Best Western Hotel Mondial for one week (July 1-8, 2006). We found the hotel to be an excellent choice, especially for visitors who plan on spending most of their time on the go. Location: The location is excellent. The hotel is located about 3 blocks from the Termini Station, meaning visitors can take a train from Fiumicino (Leonardo DaVinci) Airport to the hotel in about 30 minutes, eshewing more costly taxi cabs, which were on strike for a portion of our visit. Termini is also home to a Metro station, the only station in the system where both lines meet, making it ideal for tourists planning to use bus and metro for most of their traveling. The hotel is even closer (1.5 blocks) to another metro stop (Piazza de Republica), which takes you to popular locations like the Vatican, Vatican Museums, Spanish Steps, and Trevi Fountain. Finally, if you are interested in traveling outside of Rome, as we did to Assisi, being near Termini provides easy and prompt access to TrenItalia and Eurostar service throughout the region. Beyond transportation, Hotel Mondial is located across the street from the Opera House, and one block from Via Nationale, a main thoroughfare that is home to many restaurants and shops. For English-speaking Catholics, the hotel is just two blocks from St. Sussana's Church - which offers both Sunday and daily (6 p.m.) masses in English. Like most others in the city, the church is beautiful; and it was enjoyable to attend mass in my native language one evening. Additionally, St. Mary Major, one of the four major basilica's in Rome, is located about 4 blocks away; and St. Mary of the Angels, a beautiful church built among the remnants of an ancient bath, is just 1.5 blocks away. Rooms We found our room to be simple yet comfortable. It was very clean and the bathroom appeared to be recently renovated. In short, it met our expectations and was a great place to be able to come back to, take a shower, and sleep. The inclusive breakfast was plentiful and tasty, giving us a good start to long days in very hot weather. It started at 6:45 a.m., perfect for days in which we wanted to get an early start. The staff were very polite and bilingual. They were happy to answer questions and relay phone messages. Overall views: My wife and I enjoyed our trip to Rome very much, including our stay at the Hotel Mondial. We would return to the Hotel Mondial without question, and we wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to visitors, especially those who are not looking to spend significant sums of money on logging and who are primarily interested in a clean, comfortable, and safe location near transportation and major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: janicems
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in Italy and decided to stay somewhere simple in Rome as we were not intending to spend much time in the room as there is so much to see. The room was clean and had all the amenities necessary for our stay although it was quite dark. Unfortunately it was a little further from the centre than we had hoped, it was a long walk to most of the attractions and back up Via Nazionale to get home in the evening. The staff were reasonably friendly but not particularly cheery. Would probably stay somewhere nearer to the centre next time but for a cheaper place it's quite good if you don't mind the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Realistic expectations needed but were far surpassed at the Best Western Mondial”
Reviews.Author: d956
Reviews.Content: In a city known for ridiculously high hotel rates, I booked a prepaid, non-refundable double room rate of 148.75 Euros/night at the Best Western Mondial on Best Western's website for our stay in June 2006. At this rate, frankly, I certainly did not expect the Ritz but was pleasantly surprised upon arriving at the hotel. As promised, the hotel is an easy walk of about four blocks from Rome's Stazione Termini. Check-in was prompt and efficient and my prepaid reservation was immediately acknowledged. The room to which we were assigned was somewhat dated in decor (as was the lobby), although it was larger than most we've stayed in in Europe and the bathroom was enormous. Best of all, everything was clean and tidy and worked properly, from lamps to the plumbing fixtures to the airconditioning unit. We found the bed to be very comfortable (we like a firm mattress) and the linens and towels were spotless and soft. Breakfast was filling and more than adequate and no questions were asked when we requested an additional pot of coffee in the breakfast room. We briefly made use of the hotel's free internet connection to check emails and the only other time I asked for assistance (with dialing a local phone number), my request was answered promptly, politely and correctly. I am somewhat perplexed by the negative reviews of this hotel. Had I not found the rate I found on the Best Western website, I could have just as easily paid hundreds of Euros more per night for something elsewhere in Rome with no guarantee of anything as nice as the Mondial. If you want five stars in Rome, it is going to cost you at lest 500+ Euros/night. If you are looking for clean, central and more than adequate accomodations (with a good breakfast) at a decent price, check out the Mondial's prepaid rates. We were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “I couldnt agree more - the hotel is awful!”
Reviews.Author: jenialexis
Reviews.Content: I am going to have to agree with a previous guest - the hotel is disappointing, to say the least. According the website and booking agent, Mondial was listed as a 4 Star hotel, and it was far from it! The lobby looked like 3 stars, at most, but from then on it goes downhill....The service was terrible, concierges were borderline rude and ignored some of the questions i asked them or gave me very short, abrupt answers. The room....the room was downright scary....although decently sized (by European standards) the decor was awful, brownish pink....the beds were extra hard and the pillows lumpy....extra blankets in the closet were thin and felt like sand paper.... The bathroom was nice, fairly large and very clean, so no complaints there. The breakfast was average, i expected way way more for 250 euros per night... Long story short - we checked out of the hotel the following morning (even though we had it booked for 4 nights) and went to Hotel Guiliana (see my other review). That was great choice and I recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyGreenwood
Reviews.Content: Wow - after reading the previous reviews, I have a feeling that some rooms have been remodeled and some have not. Our room was terrific - tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean. Only blocks from the train station and in the middle of Rome, but we had no problems with street noise. We arrived early at about 11:30AM, and the staff stored our bags until the room was ready to check in. Breakfast was also great and was included in our room rate.

Reviews.Title: “4star hotel?! More like a 2 star MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ckovalyuk
Reviews.Content: We booked the Best Western Mondial for four nights starting June 1 and only stayed one night, and even that was only because we couldnt cancel it earlier. The location is ok, not the best in Rome. The only good thing is, thats its by the Termini train station, other than that you have to walk, take a train or taxi to get to the major sights. The room itself is awful! The size is good by US standards and big by European standards, but thats it. The decoration looks like a cheap, cheesy motel built in the early 80s and havent been updated since. The whole thing, from the carpet, to the closet is puke, greyish pink. The headboard is a ridiculous gold color, as are the lamps and the chairs look like worse than your grandmothers drapes, 50 years ago! The beds are incredibly hard and uncomfortable. The pillows are thin and lumpy. The best way to describe it, is a 2 star MOTEL in Las Vegas. Worst of all, the price was around $235 a night!! For this, in the U.S. you wouldve paid $30, if that. Immediately, we went on TripAdvsor and found Hotel Giuliana - a GREAT hotel, nearby. Its rated a 2 star and has very basic accomodations, but THE SERVICE!! Wow. The owners speak fluent English, know every guest by first name, are exteremly helpful and very friendly. Made our stay an absolute pleasure and at 150euros a night!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to disagree...........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't agree. This is an old hotel, with a depressing decor even in the areas that have been refurbished. Bathroom (actually a shower room) tired and cramped, though the shower was good. Room OK but nothing special. Aircon worked well but quite noisy. Room at the back was quiet for central Rome: colleagues said the front was noisy. Breakfast in a depressing and windowless room was included but was nothing special. Rome is a compact city, so any location in the city is OK. This hotel is halfway between where you would want to be and the railway station. Acceptable, but not brilliant. If you can get it cheap and just want a place to crash OK, but this is not what most people understand by a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel for your City Break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just come back from our stay at the Mondial. I agree with all the other positive reviews. Good location, you can easily walk to most of the major tourist spots, convenient for the station and metro. We had a good size room and the breakfast was good. All in all, I would fully recommend the hotel.
